Review_Title: Absolutely over the moon with the whole transaction‚Ä¶.
Review_TitleAndText: Absolutely over the moon with the whole transaction‚Ä¶. : Seamless transaction from start to finish. Got more than the starting price, we were kept up to date constantly with communication from both Motorway and the buyer direct. Money paid into account within 10 minutes of the transport company arriving and taking photos and only then do you hand over the keys. They were helpful and obliging and drove car from our house to buyer. Would highly recommend and will definitely use again. Thank you Motorway üëè

Well thought out process : Well thought out process. Went smoothly with no issues. Actually got more than first quoted. Made call Tuesday, car gone by Friday. Money in account before car was driven away. If u are honest in the beginning you will not be disappointed if they discount offer.

What A Brilliant Sevice. : If I‚Äôm brutally honest I found taking the photographs a little tricky. The software was misbehaving. However; once the photographs were done and uploaded I followed their instructions and the whole thing was simplicity itself. The Motorway experience was absolutely brilliant. The people couldn‚Äôt have been more helpful and the car was sold within 24hrs of going up for sale. Even better, their price was ¬£750.00 higher than ‚ÄúWe By Any Car‚Äù. If you have problems taking the photographs, be patient, the end result is well worth it.

Relatively simple experience : Relatively simple experience, although you do need to take a fair few photos but the app guides you through with frameworks within the picture so you can take the right angle. I needed to wait a few days for a driver to come collect the vehicle after it had been sold and the price was not higher than suggested in the Motorway advertising. However, the price was slightly better than other similar sites. Would use again.

Review_Title: I have used motorway twice before and‚Ä¶
Review_TitleAndText: I have used motorway twice before and‚Ä¶ : I have used motorway twice before and could not fault them. Sadly this time was not as good. First off, sadly the price wasn‚Äôt as we hoped, but still enough to accept. More importantly the customer services agents were not the best. One had poor English and was hard understand, the other was a little aggressive and quite frankly abrupt. Happily the sale went through ok, but knocking a star off for the before mentioned reasons.

Pretty straight forward : Pretty straight forward, plenty of quick responses and communication. Take pics, load up, detail any damage, load up documents. Wait for auction, get paid on the day of inspection before they take car away. Received payment I wanted so 5 stars

Review_TitleAndText: As it was my first time using Motorway : As it was my first time using Motorway, selling a car this way, I did'nt quite understand the system, how it all works etc, uploading the required information etc. Rang up on the day of the auction and spoke to the most helpful person in Leo Carby. He took time, to explain everything, the process, helped me upload new photos, the service history information, then called me back and went through the V5C and finance etc. Was Superb and if i could have given him 5 more stars i would have.
Easy sale : Easy sale, easy process uploading car photos etc.

Have sold 3 vehicles on here now and mostly very good experience. The last sale was not so nice but that's down to the dealer who bought the vehicle, they obviously overbid on the vehicle √†nd then picked up on the minutest issue to reduce the price they paid, however, still got a good price and reasonably hppy. I am always prepared to say no to the deal though as you're not tied in until paid which is what I like about the system.

Review_Title: Very positive experience with a better than expected outcome
Review_TitleAndText: Very positive experience with a better than expected outcome : Initial quote was excellent. Uploading photos and documents very easy. Excellent photo tool available. The whole process took 30 min from start to finish. My car went life the same evening and I received an email the next afternoon that the sale was successful achieving a price well above reserve price. Very professional after sale communication and advise. Useful DVLA links provided. All around a very very positive experience with a better than expected outcome.

Review_TitleAndText: An excellent and straightforward sale process : All instructions were clear and the process was straightforward.  Staff were very helpful over a couple of queries.  I received a very fair price for my car via the auction process and the purchaser was friendly and completed the process of purchase and collection efficiently. Overall, I would recommend Motorway's process above organisations which offer a fixed price and charge a fee for the purchase.

Review_Title: Good and Bad...Motorway itself is easy though
Review_TitleAndText: Good and Bad...Motorway itself is easy though : The motorway experience was great. Mostly positive : Overall a really positive experience, answered every question i had before purchase and couldn't have been anymore helpful. The only issue i found was to do with service history. I had called to ask about the service history and was informed it had 2 services, 1 by main dealer and 1 by them; upon receiving the car, there was nothing in the service/maintenance book, no stamps and no paperwork that backed up the 2 services. So the next day i called up and the service information was sent over via email, which is just a bit of text, still no actual paperwork. This seems a bit worthless when looking for full service history and feel it could hurt resale price in the future. Annoying because every other part of the experience has been positive.
They almost had top marks : Only had the car a couple of days so withholding comment on reliability etc for now but in regards to the transaction itself I have to say I'm happy with Cinch.

Review_Title: My worries completed by using carwow!
Review_TitleAndText: My worries completed by using carwow! : My car was entered into a company who sold cars by auction, this company wad called carwow! It was a complete surprise to me how this company worked. After giving all details on the car including the log book details, photographs of car and service history, the car was assessed for value, a reserve price added and the car offered on auction! The first offer came on the first day and was rejected because theoffer was under the reserve price! The second offer came the next time and was on the reserve price so was accepted! Carwow was checking details for me everytime I asked a question on the car sale! They were exceptional in their indulgence in selling this car for me! I applaud their  indulgence on all things!

This is crazy as I want to get my car fixed as I need it for my child.

DO NOT BUY A CAR  : Since purchasing a car from Cazoo in January, I've encountered persistent issues with the vehicle. On the day of delivery, a warning light appeared, signaling a fault. Despite multiple visits to their Lakeside store, the problem remains unresolved. To exacerbate matters, the store has closed down, and I've been redirected to a subcontractor, who has yet to rectify the issue. It's disheartening to be paying for a car that's been faulty for four months without any compensation or resolution in sight. Regrettably, I cannot recommend Cazoo based on this experience and now will be seeking legal advice.

I explained that it is not a warranty issue, but a service issue - as in it should last 12 months at least from Sept 2023! Anyway she wasn't having any of it and was rude, abrupt and super keen to end the call! Am now out of pocket! Very bad experience and wont be using cazoo again or recommending.

Keep in mind I‚Äôm selling a 10yr old car with 100000 miles. So I agreed a minimum price ¬£200 lower than the original estimate. Then I had to take half a day off work to meet the winning dealer, who test drove the car and then tried to knock another ¬£600 off for an oil leak I had evidence to show had been repaired by Ford 18 months ago. Ease of sale : The ease of selling the vehicle using the app to take photos and supply relevant information. The buyer contacted me quickly and the vehicle was collected at the specified date and time. So easy and convenient.

Recommended : First time used - was sceptical - heard horror stories about competitors reducing valuations etc - but Motorway was not only user friendly, staff helpful and true to their word, both on valuation and sale.

Plain sailing all the way : I had an excellent experience with Motorway when selling my 12 year old MINI ONE. It's the first time I've sold a car rather than trading it in as my husband and I are downsizing to one car given we're moving to a bigger city with excellent public transport. Each stage of the sale was super-easy from receiving an initial quote, to using the super-easy photography app to upload pictures, to the phone call with a staff member to talk through the car profile prior to it being entered into their daily auction. Each stage was very straightforward and dare I say it, idiot proof. I started on a Sunday and by Wednesday I had been paid by the dealer (a little more than the initial quote) and the car had been collected. Everything went off without a hitch - I definitely would use Motorway again.

Review_Title: They are a complete waste of time
Review_TitleAndText: They are a complete waste of time : They are a complete waste of time. I had for instance a free dealership survey which is worth at least ¬£500.00 but they were not interested and said they would amend the details but never did. I had higher offers from we buy any car and the dealer that I wish I had taken. They advertised the car for only 1 day at the price suggested. It took 4-5 days to go live. They would not even leave it at the price advertised. They would only advertise at a vastly lower price. I do not think one day is sufficient to allow for the car to be sold. Review_Title: Easily the worst company I have EVER‚Ä¶
Review_TitleAndText: Easily the worst company I have EVER‚Ä¶ : Easily the worst company I have EVER dealt with. Bought a Discovery Sport which broke down 2 weeks after buying it. Took Cazoo over a month before they said they couldn‚Äôt fix it and offer a refund‚Ä¶ Oh if only it were that easy!! They then said they couldn‚Äôt refund the vehicle until it was back on their site. The only reason it was at another garage is because they sent it there - Nothing to do with me! So about 6 weeks later we got a refund. I spent well over 12 hours on hold to Cazoo during this time. Every time I rang I was stuck on hold for normally between 30mins to 1.5hrs before someone answered. Then when a person does answer, they are absolutely useless. No one can give a straight answer on the phone and when I ask that they ring me back with answers they say ‚Äúno‚Äù and that they can only email me. No shock when the email they promise never arrives. Then the communication chasing cycle starts again‚Ä¶ For 6 weeks they had ¬£16k of our money, our car and for 4 weeks of that we had no courtesy car. We paid for extended warranty and I was advised that because the car broke down within 3 months, they do not need to provide a courtesy car. However if it broke down after 3 months then they would - Baffling!! After a lot of arguing they agreed to giving us a courtesy car for 2 weeks. For the other 4 weeks we were stuck relying on friends and family.

Review_TitleAndText: Fantastic service from start to finish : I can't express how happy I am with Cinch.  Ordering and paying for my new car was so easy.  Part exchanging my old car was easy. Review_Title: Honest, true account of purchase‚Ä¶ to date!
Review_TitleAndText: Honest, true account of purchase‚Ä¶ to date!  : I want to give a honest true review of my personal experience. I ordered a LandRover 21 plate but then became concerned that this was not the updated model and so rang cinch for some clarification. However, due to the long hours I work I asked my husband to do this for me however he was promised a call back but it never came. I therefore phoned them and the guy was unable to help me but promised a call back but it never came. I was anxious and so my husband drove to our local LandRover dealership and they confirmed from the pictures it was the older model. I therefore made the decision to cancel the order and purchase another LandRover with Cinch despite my reservations. I thought perhaps it was just bad luck given other reviews, I ordered my LandRover and fully financed this on 19th April 24 and then rang cinch about questions relating to the original vehicle I was going to purchase. A lovely lady took the call but was unable to help me but promised a call back. I challenged this given my experience to date but was firmly reassured she was different. Never heard from her since. I have been away to arrive back to a message that Cinch can‚Äôt deliver my car after all due to a bulge in the tyre!! Taken a day off work, had someone travel down to cover me from Essex, only to get call at 1pm day before after it‚Äôs too late to change things! I made complaint and have not heard from cinch, no new delivery date, however my finance agreement arrived with a start date of 25th April and I have yet to receive the vehicle. I am still getting letters from finance about the original vehicle and set payment dates but cinch don‚Äôt appear to be too bothered. Its been an absolute nightmare and would not recommend. Back to MotorPoint where you see the vehicle, get a date and they stick to it. Will post emails and updates just don‚Äôt want anyone experiencing issues like I have had.

Review_Title: Owen was very helpful and pleasant also‚Ä¶
Review_TitleAndText: Owen was very helpful and pleasant also‚Ä¶ : Owen was very helpful and pleasant also knowledgeable of his job x

Review_Title: STAY AWAY DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY
Review_TitleAndText: STAY AWAY DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY : If I could give this company NEGATIVE stars there wouldn't be enough to rate them how low I would want to. Absolutely stay away from this company DO NOT buy a car from them under any circumstances. We bought a car from them back in September. They gave us a date and location to pick it up, my husband arrived but there was no one and no car! My husband had to call Cinch who then informed us that they had actually damaged our car in transit and someone should have emailed us to let us know...they didn't! We had to chase them up for a further 3 weeks then eventually they dropped our car off at our house. We have also had an ongoing issue with an engine fault/emissions failure. EVERY few weeks the same fault has appeared! We have been fobbed off numerous times and Cinch are incapable of doing anything quicker than Sloth pace! First time, They sent their mechanic out to the house to 'fix' the issue. It didn't fix it! 6 weeks later same issue. Second time, they sent their mechanic out to 'fix' the issue. The mechanic told us that if it happened again it was to go directly to a Peugeot garage to have the part replaced. 3 weeks later the SAME issue. We called Cinch they couldn't get us booked in for 6 weeks but the issue was that everytime this emissions fault light came on it gave a count down from 700 miles and if we used it over 700 miles the car would not restart. So waiting 6 weeks wasn't good enough. They eventually got us booked in to a garage an hour away from our house for 3 weeks time. My husband took it on the Friday they said they ran a diagnostic, there was nothing wrong with it, reset the engine light and gave it back. 2 days later THE SAME fault! They got it booked back in to the same garage 2 weeks later this time they said it needed a new catalytic converter then all issues would be resolved! I took it on Thursday waited 6 hours while they did it and the very NEXT day...the engine fault light came back on. The car got booked in yesterday to another garage and they have now told us it's a completely different part that needs replaced but the car is not safe and we cannot have it back till they get the part which is out of stock till the end of May! In the meantime I have three children that I need a car to get to appointments and classes etc as I cannot constantly afford taxis, trains and buses and Cinch have said we may not even get a courtesy car. The amount of stress they have caused through their lack of customer service, lack of customer care and absolute lack of responsibility is unbelievable. The WORST company I have ever had the misfortune of dealing with. Just wanted to add this is an ongoing issue but has been going on for 6 months now.

Poor customer service : We have been trying to get some information about a purchase that has been made but hasn‚Äôt been delivered. The WhatsApp customer service has been poor, was advised someone would be in contact and still waiting.

Review_Title: Motorway is not the best way to sell your used car.
Review_TitleAndText: Motorway is not the best way to sell your used car.  : I tried to sell my car through Motorway recently and the whole experience wasn‚Äôt pleasurable. We received an offer above their valuation which we accepted. Five days later the dealer arrived to pick the car up. After checking the car on my drive for 45 minutes he then took it for a test drive. He returned 15 minutes later and asked if the car was a fuel injection model to which I replied it is was not advertised as a fuel injection so why do you think it is a fuel injection. He decided not to take the car. I then called Motorway and asked what my options were. After a couple of calls I was told that the dealer pulled out of the deal as it had an electrical fault which it does not. I explained the reason why he did not really take the car but the only way they would advertise the car again is if I took the car to an auto electrician and get a full report off them. The person I spoke to would not listen to me when I advised that the dealer was using the electrical fault as an excuse and the car is fault free. We were left with no other choice but to remove our car from motorway. In my experience I would not recommend Motorway to anyone or ever use them again.
Great and prompt! : Great and prompt!

the most awful experience‚Ä¶ : I have had the most awful experience from this company right from the get go. I am never the one to write reviews but it‚Äôs gone this far where I have to seek as much action as I possibly can. If there was an option for a 0 star I would have clicked that. I purchased a car on the 5th of December 2023, after 3 weeks of having the car I had multiple issues already going on with the car such as engine fault, reverse camera not working and the windscreen wipers not working. The car was booked in for repair on the 8th of February 2024 to their Birmingham repair centre, no repairs were done and still to this day the car is still in their possession. Since then, I have sent numerous complaint emails which I am yet to get a reply and I have tried numerous times to get hold of them, it‚Äôs honestly near impossible. The customer service is absolutely disgusting and I would definitely not ever recommend this company to anyone.

I was given a price, expecting to be knocked down but it was appraised and the money offered was given, the money was in my account within minutes, nothing hidden, no catches, so straight forward. Highly recommend Cazoo

Review_Title: I have issues with the tax refund.
Review_TitleAndText: I have issues with the tax refund. : I have issues with the tax refund. Originally I placed an order for Audi Q2, which has different tax band (apparently) , so they asked me to pay ¬£99 directly to Cazoo via a link provided in an email which I did. Then I cancelled the order and switch to a different car (Audi A3). With this car I paid the tax directly to DVLA website. So I asked for the ¬£99 refund because I already cancelled the previous order. I called 3 times asking for the refund and Cazoo said they will get back to me. That was 2 weeks ago and until now still nothing. No reply to the email I have sent neither. So they took the ¬£99 meant for the tax instead of returning the money back to me. So if you were asked to pay anything through a link, don‚Äôt do it and pay directly to DVLA instead.

Review_Title: Got a fair price for the car
Review_TitleAndText: Got a fair price for the car : Got a fair price for the car. Took a bit more time, effort and stress than other platforms but worth it for a better return. Would have liked to have been able to enter some of my own text into the listing to point out finer details which would affect the desirability and value to the dealer. Some details I wanted to declare didn't quite fit into the standard responses used for the valuation. Some of these finer details would of made the car likely to achieve a better bid, others by being fully described would leave the dealer with absolutely nothing to chip you down on when they come to collect the car. Call centre background noise made  communication with Motorway difficult. Removing photos I had carefully uploaded of service documents from my listing at the point my car went live to auction was frustrating. It ended before this was corrected despite me notifying Motorway who sent me a bizarre email resposse from someone who clearly had not fully read my question. Luckily car still ended with a bid I was happy with. Collecting dealer was fair and easy to deal with although did chip me down on things there was nowhere for me to have declared. Still would recommend Motorway as a reasonable price was achieved without too much fuss.

Review_Title: Horrendous Aftercare if your car has issues. Avoid at all costs
Review_TitleAndText: Horrendous Aftercare if your car has issues. Avoid at all costs  : The worst customer service I have received from any company, ever. Bar none. Sold me a car with a tyre that was smaller than the rest and it made it seem like the TPMS sensor was not working. It took me multiple trips (about 10 in total at my own expense) to multiple service centers and dealerships to identify and fix the issue. The issue was highlighted during the 7 day money back guarantee but took 5 months for me to find out what the real issue was and that was at a different garage using my own money which they refused to compensate because apparently I had to get approval before I went to get it checked.

Review_Title: Faulty AUX battery within 6 months of purchase
Review_TitleAndText: Faulty AUX battery within 6 months of purchase : Bought a 2019 A Class and had several battery warning lights which started to appear as soon as a day after taking delivery. Reported twice during 3 month warranty however was told the battery was checked prior to sale. It is now less than 6 months after purchasing and when renewing the MOT have been told the AUX battery is faulty and needs to be replaced. Cazoo unwilling to help as it is outside the 3 month warranty which seems incredibly unfair given an aux battery should not be failing within 6 months. I now have to pay for the labour to replace the battery as well as the new part. Tried to ring the helpline on several occasions however it is impossible to get through, was on hold on one occasion for 65 minutes with no answer so had to give up. Emailed multiple times with no helpful responses to date. I chose Cazoo on the basis that I thought they sold good quality cars, that‚Äôs why you pay a premium. Genuinely one of the worst customer experiences I have had purchasing any product online.
Would highly recommend  : Was so easy and cazoo were really helpful car delivered and guy took me all round car explaining everything was more than happy with the service

90 Day Warranty  : While the car itself exceeds expectations, the aftercare service provided by Cazoo leaves much to be desired. Despite lodging a report almost a month ago due to a faulty bonnet cable, which falls under the 90-day warranty, we've yet to see any progress toward resolution. Compounding the issue is the inconvenience of having to transport the vehicle to the nearest 'Cazoo approved' mechanic, which is over an hour away, without any assistance for time or fuel costs. It's disheartening to contrast the exceptional quality of the car with the disappointing aftercare experience. Although I managed to connect with a call handler who initially promised to facilitate a quote approval for the necessary repairs, subsequent follow-ups have yielded only radio silence. This review is a reflection of our ongoing frustration with Cazoo's aftercare service, despite an otherwise flawless car purchase experience

Review_Title: would give no stars if I could
Review_TitleAndText: would give no stars if I could  : would give no stars if I could , Completely Avoid , 10/10 service when I bought the car and it stops there , I reported some Major issues when I bought the car back in December , which in fairness they did arrange for me to bring the car back in to be addressed , but only did half the works and forgot the mechanical side of the works had reported ! , I have chased for over 2 months to have the other issues addressed and had raised more issues since ( 2 of them serious issues that obviously were not picked up on their 300 point check ) I advised the car was not safe to drive all the way back to the showroom ( Chertsey ) , which my pleas where ignored and I was told to call the RAC . I had a huge battle of arranging a courtesy car ( after being told subject to avalibluitly and that they cant do anything knowing I was being left without a car !!! even though I was told I would have a car ready if I was to have any issues by the seller  ) I have had to call at least 30+times  after being on hold no sooner than 50 mins ,  to chase this up being left massively out of pocket on work , time spent on the phone at work and simply not being able to use my car as I intended for work and family , plus the stress of it all has been a complete joke and really taken its tole,  I finally managed a date with Cazoo in which I bought back the car on 10.3.24 due for the works to be carried out on 12.3.24 - today is the 1.4.24 and no one seems to know where my car is or its progress on the works , I have chased them again over 20+times with not 1 single update on my car which is disgusting , ive been told this has been put as urgent , flagged with both senior management and the show room and have been promised twice senior calls back last week - I haven't had so much as an email let alone a phone call , I a furious , im now looking into legal action and compensation as this has single handily been the worst experience  I have had to deal with , the reason for me getting this car was to assist in medically ill family members , im sure now that I have gone public I will get a response , truth of the matter I don't want the car anymore as for the last month I don't know what's happened with it  , all this has really broken me as a person and I will never use a platform like this again to by a car , to date since buying the car late 2023 , not a single item I have raised has been closed and I have had no update
KeyPhrases: promised twice senior calls back last week

Review_Title: Bought car for cazoo in November 2022.
Review_TitleAndText: Bought car for cazoo in November 2022.  : Bought car for cazoo in November 2022 started using air conditioning  in May - blowing out hot air.

Very Poor Customer service : I picked up my car on the 30/12/23 to find my car didn't have a parcel shelf. I was assure that one would be ordered which I requested it to be delivered to myself due to not living local to a centre. I was told multiple times that it was awaiting the courier to collect it, and then on the 15th Feb I was called by the centre in Lakeside saying it was ready to collect. I told them again I had specifically said I need it to be delivered as I live 2 hours away from the nearest centre. I was assured that it would be delivered, and I made them aware that I was moving house on March 1st so I needed it delivered before then. On the 21st Feb I was told once again that they were awaiting for the courier to collect the parcel and I would get it within a week. After sending more email, I got a reply on the 7th March asking if I had received the parcel before I moved, to which I replied no on the same day. I then send further emails on the 4th, 9th, 18th as well as trying multiple online chats to which there was never anyone available and  I never received any follow-up emails, and also attempting to call Cazoo to which I would be on hold for an hour unable to speak to anyone. I am utterly appalled by the lack of communication and the fact of 3 months later I still haven't received the parcel shelf for my car. I strongly urge people to rethink purchasing a car with Cazoo, I've never dealt with such poor customer service and extreme lack of communication.

Review_TitleAndText: In trouble and do not get in contact plus phone lines jammed  : Sorry Cazoo that your model has not worked and you are ceasing car sales. I see the response time to 1 star reviews is quicker on trustpilot so I‚Äôve tried that.  Fault reference is 01845913 for a V40.  This should hopefully give enough information for you to hopefully be in touch with me to resolve. I would appreciate quick and easy resolution and star rating would be adjusted.   Too many reviews on here are in the first flush of excitement on collecting a car.  The real service occurs when there is a problem to resolve.  Just a phone call to progress would be progress!    Note also that positive reviews get replies within a day or so.   Mmmm‚Ä¶.   Priorities‚Ä¶.

Review_Title: Nightmare! No stars if I could.
Review_TitleAndText: Nightmare! No stars if I could. : Nightmare!! I sold the vehicle in the first auction for a great price. It took a little longer than expected for the buying dealer to come to my address and look at the vehicle but never mind. I was not daft enough to not expect a little attempt at the buying dealer to try and negotiate slightly even though I had appraised the vehicle correctly on the motorway system. I would say the car was a 9.5 out of 10. I had a couple of wheel refurbishments done and a new windscreen under the cars insurance to avoid as much negotiation as possible. My girlfriend was subjected to a ¬£1500 price reduction on collection. I could have lived with ¬£100 maybe even ¬£150, but they were trying to take the mick. So I reattempted to sell through motorway again this time making sure everything was noted down even marks as small as a dot on a piece of paper were declared. It again sold, this time for less money. I wasn‚Äôt best pleased but was happy to move on and get it sorted. Two weeks on from selling for a 2nd time and motorway ‚Äúcannot get in touch‚Äù with the buyer as they are not responding to them. I have been made aware on a couple of occasions that the buyer (BIG Motoring world, aka BIG waste of time) buy hundreds of cars from Motorway each month. Heaven knows why they won‚Äôt respond to Motorway regarding this purchase. I don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs the case but I‚Äôll never get to know why. They suggested contacting the 2nd highest bidder and once again (after a few more days have passed) can‚Äôt obtain contact with these people either. It‚Äôs safe to say my experience with Motorway had been disastrous. I would not consider using Motorway ever again. I had to chase things repeatedly and was told ‚Äúok leave it with me we will call you back‚Äù.  Not once did they call me back. If you are looking to use motorway rather than part exchange my advice is try and get a good price with the dealer, Motorway isn‚Äôt all it‚Äôs cracked up to be. Yes the price they say looks great but let me tell you it‚Äôs not been worth the hassle.

Fantastic service : Hard to find fault with any part of the service offered by Cinch. Had a small query after purchasing my car which was answered quickly. Cinch also provided the details for taxing the vehicle and arranging 3 days free insurance in the run-up to delivery. On delivery date, I got a text message first thing, narrowing the delivery window from 8am-1pm, to 10 - 11am. The delivery driver (Richard) then called at around 9.30 to confirm he'd be arriving by 10, which he did. Richard explained all the need-to-knows about the car and return policy, and was friendly and polite. Excellent from start to finish.

Review_Title: Mis-sold a damaged car - do not buy from Cinch!
Review_TitleAndText: Mis-sold a damaged car - do not buy from Cinch! : I would give Cinch 0 stars if I could. Absolutely appalling service and extremely unhappy with the car I purchased. After only having the car a few months, the paint started to peel off the front (19 plate so it's not old at all!) After getting a couple of professional opinions and looking at the car in more detail, it is evident that the vehicle has been damaged or been in an accident before and the repairs have been done to an extremely low standard, which I am now left to repair properly and pay for. Cinch did not list these damages on the advertisement, nor did their pre-sale inspections (that they claim to do) pick this up before selling me the car. I have put in a complaint which they have been slow to deal with and will be fighting for them to take the car back and give me a full refund. Extremely disappointed that I have been mis-sold a previously damaged car with no knowledge of this, and have been given a massive quote to get these damages rectified. Do not buy from Cinch and buy from a more trustworthy dealership!

False information given on delivery  : I had a car delivered from cinch on 16th December 2023. On this date my father had asked about tyres if they were new, the windscreen wipers as well as they were grinding on the windscreen aswell as the breaks as as my father said they looked worn. Despite being told by the cinch worker that all were in perfect working condition and that the tyres are new on as-well as the breaks my car went into Mercedes Benz due to an faulty part they informed me that the breaks were 85% worn and I was in need of replacement break discs and break pads and the tyres need changing immediately due to them being almost bald. At this point I had the car 4 1/2 months and have driven the expected mileage for this time frame as far as I‚Äôm aware with a car of 85% worn discs and tyres nearly bald with just over 4 months of driving i should have been informed of the condition of these and not falsely told information. I understand that I would‚Äôve contributed to this wear however not for a new condition which what i was told.

Review_Title: Go with Cazoo if you want a faulty car and bad customer services
Review_TitleAndText: Go with Cazoo if you want a faulty car and bad customer services : I purchased a car and when we picked it up the electronics of the vehicle were not working. We returned the vehicle and as it was a part exchange we couldn't get our old vehicle back and they kept some of the money due to returning their faulty vehicle.
Process went smoothly : Process went smoothly. Staff were helpful.
the man came out : the man came out, checked my car, paid the money. easy as that.

Absolutely awful company : Absolutely awful company. Ordered a Tesla online, 2 days before delivery was told there was a mechanical issue so would need a few days to sort. This ended up being a GDPR issue as previous owner was still on the infotainment system - so car not ready to sell, why is it on the website, also not really a mechanical issue is it, also this happens often and you can change owner over 3-4 business days using the V5. Rang every day trying to find out more information, the customer service team ranged from trying to be helpful to downright rude. Either way they were never able to help as they don‚Äôt have communications with the ‚Äúservice‚Äù team - just a messaging service, and the service team never update the system. The following week I was told the car was at Tesla to have the previous owner removed (factory reset - this takes about 2 minutes‚Ä¶). Again, rang every day for updates, was never able to be given an expected completion date or delivery date. The next week told the car was going to Tesla at the end of the week - hang on, I thought it was already there?! But still not able to give me an exact day or delivery date. End of the week they don‚Äôt know where the car is or the state of the fix. Finally offered a bit of money off and a hire car. But wait, the finance offer has now expired (21 days). So finance will be cancelled, this takes 10 days to wind down, at which point they very kindly said I would be able to repurchase the car and apply for finance again. I get the email that the finance has been wound down, rung cazoo - yes the car is now ready, and yes you can repurchase. But now we‚Äôre no longer selling cars really so we‚Äôre not offering finance, and no you can‚Äôt split to put a bit on your credit card to give you section 75 protection and sorry but the warranty is now just 30 days. Shove your car as far up your rectum as it will reach and thank you very much for wasting a month of my life. Absolute jokers.

Review_Title: I purchased a Tesla Model 3 on the 29th‚Ä¶
Review_TitleAndText: I purchased a Tesla Model 3 on the 29th‚Ä¶ : I purchased a Tesla Model 3 on the 29th of February 2024, and fully paid for it on the 8th of March. However, the delivery scheduled for that day was cancelled due to an incomplete MOT, a scuffed alloy wheel, and a crack in the sunroof. Since then, I have received no cooperation or assistance from Cazoo. The customer support staff constantly fob me off, making me wait on hold for over 30 minutes every time I call. Even when they do answer, they promise to look into the issue but fail to take any action. It is frustrating that my finance payments are set to begin in 12 days for a car I have not even laid eyes on. After complaining on social media, and enduring an almost 4-week wait for the car delivery, to my dismay, Cazoo has decided today to cancel my order! I am now faced with a 5-working day wait for the refund of my deposit, and I will be required to make my initial finance payment for a car that I never laid eyes on. I strongly advise against using this service for anyone considering it. Absolute rubbish.

Review_TitleAndText: Update 2 20-Apr-24 : Bought a 2021 Polestar 2 via Cazoo‚Ä¶ : Bought a 2021 Polestar 2 via Cazoo which was delivered Sunday 24th March. Everything seemed OK via Fast Chargers until I tried to charge it on Type 2 AC (3 Pin Granny / 7kW wall box / 7kW single phase Pod Point at my workplace) and it would error. Review_TitleAndText: Very poor service  : I would like to express my unsatisfactory and frustrating service with Cazoo. I purchased my car on the 13th and that I can collect it on the 20th only to be told a day before that I can‚Äôt collect the car as there‚Äôs a faulty battery and that I will get a update on the 23rd with the next steps. I didn‚Äôt get no update, no calls, emails, nothing. I had to call every single day(twice a day) to find out what‚Äôs been going on. I got told the MOT would be done on the 26th, I called and again I got promised a contact in the next 45 minutes and again I waited for 2 hours and got no contact. Checked the GOV.UK website and saw the MOT was not done. I called to find out what happened, again, they failed to tell me and said sorry for the inconvenience. I then cancelled the whole car. I am absolutely frustrated, dissatisfied and disappointed with the customer service and the fact that I have to chase every single day by calling? All they seem to do is lie and over promise but not actually do what they say, if they had updated me I would have actually considered staying. Not only that, they offered me ¬£150 compensation for the delay. I spent over 18k, what do you mean ¬£150 compensation? I also spent 3000 on insurance to which I have to cancel due to the inconvenience and lack of consistency. DO NOT EVER BUY FROM HERE!!!!!!

Negatives - the reserve price was set by the Carwow team and I felt that it was lower than I would‚Äôve preferred and did not account for some significant extras and extended factory warranty. You are obligated to the sale if the reserve is met. Sale was exactly at the reserve price and I assume that the buyers can see this price in advance. Reserve price was clearly set lower to ensure that Carwow received a commission. So next time I will hold to a price and go elsewhere if not set at the right level for me.

Review_Title: Awful ongoing experience.. terrible level of customer service
Review_TitleAndText: Awful ongoing experience.. terrible level of customer service : I was supposed to receive my car on Saturday 13th April between the hours of 1-6pm. A few hours before I was informed my vehicle was on its way I received a phone call from cinch to inform me there was a problem with the petrol cap on the car but if I was happy to still receive the car today it would be booked into a nearby garage to be fixed at a later date, to which I agreed too as I needed the car and had chosen this specific delivery date to line up with work commitments that required a vehicle. Less than an hour before my car was due to arrive I missed a call and had a follow up email informing me that the speedometer had stopped working in transit and the car had to be turned around and taken back to be fixed. As you can imagine this was not ideal for me as I needed the car for work that following Monday for work and was not filled with much confidence as there were already 2 faults to a car I had just purchased.

Review_Title: 1 out of 500 dealers bidded!! and such a low price
Review_TitleAndText: 1 out of 500 dealers bidded!! and such a low price : Made an initial enquiry, then spammed to death with emails promising the best price from 500 dealers. Downloaded the app, took about an hour to take pics and show all the evidence requested. Originally promised a reasonable price for my 11yr old, 95k miles Corsa, for ¬£1800. Then once I shared the pics, it had 3 marks, each 2-3 mm, they took off ¬£300. So now we were down to a reserve price of ¬£1,500. For a car that age, a buyer is not expecting perfection so I was not happy. Apart from these tiny marks it was a great car. So we decided to see how the auction went. ¬£1,295 was the best offer and it was the only offer. So much for their 500 dealers. I see much older cars than this in dealers selling for twice the price.

Lack of communication  : They need to communicate to their clients better. Got accepted for the car, paid the deposit, signed the papers, booked all required things, 2 days before the collection date I was told i was declined days ago. Now i do not mind being declined as I am young student, but do not accept me and then state that I have the car. All in all unorganised, lack of communication with clients and amongst the partners.

I will miss Cazoo  : Second car I buy from Cazoo. Such a shame they are changing the way they work because this was such a brilliant idea for people like me who don‚Äôt like to drive around to used car dealerships and dealing with salespeople. Very happy with the delivery and the quality of my used vw up! Shame I probably won‚Äôt be able to buy like this through them again.
Very good communication : Very good communication, easy to follow instructions. Delivery was right on time with a friendly helpful delivery driver.

Awful experience  : Absolutely terrible experience from start to the very finish which resulted in them pulling the sale. I bought a car 3 weeks ago from cazoo and was due to collect it the following weekend (9 days after purchasing). Then 24hrs before collection and after having had sold my own vehicle, I received a call to say that there was a fault with the car and I was no longer able to collect- I had purchased train tickets to get from Cornwall up to Bristol and have still not been reimbursed for these! I was informed I would be updated on 14th March. The 14th came and went and there was no communication despite numerous calls and emails on my behalf to them with very limited information. I was then informed a couple of days later that the part had arrived and they would inform me in due course when it was repaired. Again days passed by with no communication, so again I had to chase. I was then told a day later that all was fixed and a new collection date was arranged. AGAIN, 24hrs before my collection date I am told that there is another fault and that the part necessary isn‚Äôt available and the car was being withdrawn from a sale. I am now without a car and need to travel over 30 miles a day for work, out of pocket due to paying for insurance and tax which I was told to do by cazoo before pick up and still out of pocket for the train tickets. There is very limited compassion in this company and a huge break down of communication. DO NOT buy from cazoo unless you want to be ripped off!

Aftercare is frustrating : Buying the car was a good experience, very helpful staff and the car itself was great. The problems come with the aftercare, sounds like a wheel bearing has gone note after having the car just over a month, which should be covered in the 90 day warranty but I can‚Äôt get hold of anyone! Spent hours on hold after a few attempts at calling as instructed to do so by the website. Also emailed and they acknowledged but no response since. Really frustrating at this point.

Review_Title: I have recently in the last few weeks‚Ä¶Nightmare
Review_TitleAndText: I have recently in the last few weeks‚Ä¶Nightmare : I have recently in the last few weeks bought a car from Cazoo, I have never experienced anything like it so far! The car has had an issue the day after I bought it. They booked me into a garage 40 miles away, 2.5hr round trip I had to take a days holiday, and spent 6.5hrs at the dealership to be told that it would need to come back as they did not have the part! OK fair enough, when eventually I do get hold of somebody and explained the situation the lady was excellent, to get the car sorted I have now been booked into a garage which will be a 3.5hr round trip, 172 miles! I have a dealer 5 mins from work which I explained why book it miles away. They make a booking without giving you any notice or ask if you can make that booking. The live chat has disappeared, messenger is not being answered and I have now been waiting on the phone for another hour! 3 Hours to get a booking last time and the booking is unacceptable. I'm doing them a favour to say I cannot make the booking! I wish I had handed the car back after 7 days but gave them the benefit, never had an experience like it, I would avoid at all costs. Customer services is non existent as you cannot get anyone to answer to help! I have also taken out an extra 3 years warranty, I cannot handle this every time I have an issue, the worst purchase I have ever made.

Inspection of the car : I have collected the car on 6/2/2024. Everything seemed good. I driven it for a month then decided to get the MOT done to find out if Everything is good unfortunately I failed the MOT because of one tyres inner edge was cut to the cords. I then had the get the tyre changed and to be back on the road. If I had been caught by the police because of the tyre I would have been fined and left with at least 3 penalty points and i would have been responsible because I am the owner.

Really poor experience : Really poor experience, it started okay at the beginning, but after our car was sold online to dealer ,it then went downhill, I had a feeling that the dealer had no intention of buying it due to lack of response after the bid was made,after a few days of me trying to get a collection date ,I e mailed customer services,to ask them to chase it up ,it was then I found out how bad their customer service were at Carwow, loads of promises to chase up but never got back to me, the customer services have  a mobile number in their e mail which they never answer ,eventually I got a call from the dealer who wanted to collect in a weeks time ,which was not in the time frame given by car wow ,it was supposed to be within 48 hours,when he did arrive 4 days later ,he really was not interested in buying which was my first thoughts on this dealer  ,I was not there at the beginning but when I got there  he told me that my wife had told him the car was using 1lt of oil a month which was a complete lie ,she did not say anything of the sort, after he left without buying it , I spoke to Carwow ,who by this time I realised that are there for the dealer and not the seller as they will side with the dealer and not you which they did on this case ,so I would say take it somewhere else ,we went to webuyanycar.com and the deal was done in 20 minutes at a price we were happy with , just whish we had done at first

Review_TitleAndText: Worst and most frustrating car buying‚Ä¶ : Worst and most frustrating car buying experience of my life.! DO NOT USE CAZOO : Cazoo USED to be fantastic but DO NOT buy a car from them. I purchased a car from them March 2024. I drove it home and found a catalogue of problems with it. Telephoned them but customer services were not helpful, I took the vehicle back to Chertsey where the branch manager kept me waiting. We agreed a plan to get the issues fixed with Vauxhall. Never heard back from branch manager regarding some requests I made. After another warning light came on I decided to return the vehicle. Thats another headache in itself. Its the total lack of communication. No-one taking responsibility. No 'sorry' for my inconvenience. They are slow. They never respond to emails. Im sure Ill get it sorted but it will be at my expense, my time, my effort and me chasing them all the time. Its just a major headache just dont bother buying from them in the first instance. You have been warned!

Beware of changes : I input details and received an estimated price. I then listed the vehicle with required photos. So far, so good. The first issue appeared to be that the operative that phoned me had a very strong foreign accent and appeared to be reading from a script rather than having an understanding of cars. We had a long discussion detailing any issues/damage to the car as I did not want any surprises having read other reviews. Although minor car park dents were visible on photos I was asked for more photos. We then agreed a lower price taking all these details into account. The following day they emailed me a lower price. Various emails followed but with no satisfactory answer. I agreed to sell my vehicle and received an acceptable offer. When the car was collected I was offered a reduced price because of minor wheel damage that had already been declared. Luckily the proposed reduction was not too great. I leave you all to make your own judgements on service from this information but from what I have heard this experience is not uncommon. The only thing I can say is that I received a figure that I originally wanted but not as originally estimated.

Review_Title: Please don‚Äôt trust their sweet words during sale.
Review_TitleAndText: Please don‚Äôt trust their sweet words during sale.  : When I picked up the car, there was a squeaky noise and the sales person told it will be fixed and they have ordered for parts. I asked them if this going to affect my 7day return policy, and they assured me that it is going to be fixed as soon as the part arrives as they have already ordered it from Mercedes. 2 weeks later, this is the response received.

Buy Locally : I like the concept of buying online and having the car delivered (optional additional cost) and the option to return within seven days, no questions asked. That part of the experience is spot on. However, if you‚Äôre unlucky to choose a car that has issues like I am having, then the experience is painful and frustrating. I bought a Land Rover Discovery, and after two days, the orange engine light came on. I called Cazoo, and it took me an hour to get through, and they booked me into Bristol Centre in two weeks. I took it there to be told it was a DPF issue and had to book it in for the following week to be cleaned and flushed (I‚Äôm no expert, by the way). I returned it the following week and drove back, bare in mind each journey is an hour each way, and the orange engine light came back on when I got home. I was fuming! I called customer services again (another hour waiting) for them to book me into a local garage, which has another layer of process involved. The garage inspects the problem, which has to be approved by Cazoo (that took them over a week). It took another two weeks for the work to be done. Unfortunately the new DPF has triggered up new issue. I have been without a car for three weeks and I am still waiting from Cazoo to respond to my emails and I don‚Äôt have the time to wait an hour or more to speak to them. This has to be the worst car buying experience I have ever had. I was told by the line manager at the Bristol branch that the company is struggling financially and don‚Äôt have the after care support it is needed to make this a perfect car buying experience. This has really put me off for life from ever buying from Cazoo or any other online car retailer. If you do choose to buy from Cazoo, I hope you‚Äôre lucky enough to buy one that‚Äôs not faulty.

Review_Title: Dont buy the Cazoo extended warranty
Review_TitleAndText: Dont buy the Cazoo extended warranty : Cazoo extended warranty, shocking service having to haggle labour costs. I have an issue with Range Rover Evoque central locking on one door. I thought the Actuator had failed as its a known problem. I contact Assurant who recommended a local garage who charge at Assurant's labour rates (¬£60ph). Took car to garage this morning, they undertook a diagnostic to confirm new actuator required, The garage contacted Assurant to give quotation for the repair. Assurant agreed the part cost ¬£152, but only pay ¬£50 for the hour's labour for diagnostic and 0.7 hr to fit the new part, SO LEAVING ME WITH A ¬£200 LABOUR BILL! Youtube and Land Rover dealership and independent confirm an hour's diagnostic and up to 3 HOURS for fitting the part. I contacted Assurant and said their understanding of labour costs was na√Øve to say the least, their excuse was that they use Autodata to judge labour time, suggest they use common sense and experience to have a realistic estimation of repair time. This database in not akin to the Post Office Horizon programme? Have paid for the diagnostic already so i could get my car back while I wait for the part and decision from the Assurant complaints team!
Not worth buying from Cazoo : Sold a car previously to Cazoo, first class service from start to finish.

One of the best deals! : We didn't know that Cazoo would withdraw from used car sales until after we paid the full price of the car in cash on 8th March. We only realised something was a bit strange when checking out becasue Cazoo didn't let us buy extended warranty which they had just stopped selling. We were very worried after reading all the recent reviews posted here. But today (15 March) we (or rather my husband) picked up the car at Wembley (thanks to Benjamin) and we are very happy now. The car was competitively priced - probably one of the best deals we found. The car is clean inside and out. We even had an independent mechanic inspect the car this afternoon and he confirmed that it is in a good condition.

Review_TitleAndText: Don‚Äôt be fooled by the branding!  : Bought a car, damage to the car was not mentioned or visible from any pictures. These were reported at the earliest opportunity. This got worse so within the 90 day warranty I notified Cinch. Good as gold picked up, left a courtesy car. They returned my car saying it was fixed, it wasn‚Äôt the fault was still there. I told them now to only return it when the fault has actually been fixed, expecting them to keep me informed of its progress, nothing!! In the last 2 1/2 weeks I have tried to get some answers by calling them, each time waiting a minimum of 30 minutes for the phone to be picked up. I have on each occasion been fobbed off saying someone will contact me but they don‚Äôt. I emailed 5 days ago and still had no response to that email. Just a regular update would be nice!! We are now about to enter May 2024 and I still have not got the car I am paying for which is a more sizeable car than the loan car and no answers from Cinch. I recommend if you are considering buying a used car, look elsewhere!!!

Terrible experience with Cazoo : Terrible experience with Cazoo, ordered a Mercedes A class for delivery the following week. Received an email after a couple of days to say the bumper needed replacing and delivery would be delayed , this instantly raised concerns , how could the bumper suddenly be so damaged it needed repairing after looking at the pictures and having an inspection? Trying to get hold of cazoo was near on impossible, the live chat kicks you off and says there are no agents available, I was on hold on numerous times for over 45 minutes with still no one answering. The only communication was through emails which took days to respond to. After raising all of my concerns and stating I wish for the delivery and admin fee to be refunded and asking what actually happened to the bumper, I had a reply of your questions will be put through to the wider team. On the day my car was supposed to be delivered I had a call to say they couldn‚Äôt fix the problem and my car was being pulled from sale. After applying for finance and selling my own car I am now left without a vehicle, I cannot apply for more finance until this case is closed which could take 2 weeks and also awaiting my refund deposit which will take 3-5 days. For all of the inconvenience all cazoo can offer is ¬£250 off another vehicle , absolutely would not purchase with them again and now left without a car until this is all settled and have to start my search again. Very disappointed and would not recommend buying with Cazoo.

Review_Title: The worst customer experience I‚Äôve ever‚Ä¶
Review_TitleAndText: The worst customer experience I‚Äôve ever‚Ä¶ : The worst customer experience I‚Äôve ever had.

Review_Title: Do not waste your time and money on cazoo
Review_TitleAndText: Do not waste your time and money on cazoo : The only good part about the experience was getting the price quoted to me for my part exchange, everything else was bad. Collecting the car I wasn't informed on anything going on the guy took my car keys to inspect my car and let me look at my car. After that I never saw him again and later learned he had accepted my car for the exchange, handed the keys in to reception without telling me with all my personal belongings still in the car. After collecting them I was given the keys for the car outside and assumed it was a test drive, drove it less than a mile and noticed things wrong the "300 point inspection" should've which they couldn't fix then and there due to no technicians. I found out later this wasnt a test drive and I was meant to take the car for good then so after actually being informed I took it away feeling as if I've been scammed which I later found true to an extent. Getting the car back home I found out a fake MOT had been put on it after taking it to a garage to get looked at. Previous MOT that failed stated leaking dampers then it disappeared as if magic. After inspection there is about ¬£700 worth of work needing done as soon as possible about ¬£171 of which i had to pay upfront so I could drive the car. After emailing with customer service I was told to send an email in with the predicted costs and they would get back to me within 4 working days.... Nothing. Called back, after another hour long wait got through to someone who told me because they haven't contacted me I could send them an email with the prices and they would accept it immediately and allow me to send them the invoice to pay it off. I asked for his statement in writing through an email to prove it since it felt too good to be true he promised he would and surprise surprise no email and was told I'd be contacted within 4 days. It's now been about another month and nothing has happened. Today my car now makes a horrible noise driving due to the dust cover for the brake falling off and resting on the brakes. Currently been on hold for 1 hour and 51 minutes trying to get through to someone with a brain to help me get my money which I highly doubt will actually happen. This has been the worst experience buying a car I've had and I've had a car completely break before after 5 days of buying it. I will never use cazoo again and I hope people see this and change their minds using them.

Absolute joke : Absolute joke! This company has the WORST customer service, you are never able to talk to someone and when you finally get through they don't know what to do and put you through to another automated service! We bought a car in September, by October there was an issue with the engine which meant the car became undrivable until fixed. We took out warranty with Cazoo (just Incase anything major happened) but you guessed it, trying to find an RAC approved garage was nearly impossible and we went back and forth between different automated options! Now we have just been told that Cazoo warranty want a second opinion on the engine ... Even though it's one of their OWN APPROVED GARAGES!!! The whole scenario has been extended stressful and is still not resolved! Don't waste your time buying cars or their warranty!!

Review_Title: Amazing service from the Cinch mobile‚Ä¶
Review_TitleAndText: Amazing service from the Cinch mobile‚Ä¶ : Amazing service from the Cinch mobile service van today. The mechanic Norbert was brilliant and got to work straight away, changing and checking all the bits that needed doing. He was efficient, polite and informative.

Shocking customer service : The actual process of buying a car and part exchange was straight forward and pain free.  HOWEVER the customer service since then has been shocking. We have an issue with a door not locking. Firstly we were told it would be 6 weeks before it could be dealt with at our nearest main dealer.  Then they got us into a main dealer a bit further away, but with the assurance we could have a courtesy car. 2 days before it was due to go in the main dealer rang us and said there would be no courtesy car and they would need it probably all day, maybe longer. We live in the sticks over 40 miles away with no other vehicle. We contacted cinch again. They gave us another option of taking it a local garage, paying for it ourselves, but there was no guarantee we would be reimbursed.  We have requested a manager phone us, but was told they are too busy. We have emailed 5 or 6 times trying to resolve this but have no reply whatsoever. We are happy to wait and go back to the original main dealer who is more local to us, but do still need a courtesy car. Since then a few other problems have arisen with the car, but don't hold out much hope of them being fixed either. So how long do we have to run around in a car which doesn't fully lock?

Unhappy with condition of car : I have emailed the Cinch experience team and did have a response to say this has now been passed onto the aftercare team but I am yet to have a response after 8 days and after emailing asking for any update. I‚Äôve been receiving emails saying I have not yet left a review so this is the reason for this review on here. I received my car last week from James who was very lovely, pleasant and professional. However I am disappointed in the condition I have received my car in. I could tell immediately that the previous owners had a dog as there is a strong dog smell in the car. There is also a lot of dog hair as well as many marks, scratches and stains on the inside of the car that were not stated as imperfections prior to me purchasing this car. There is a sticky mark on the back of the passenger seat, there are multiple scratches on the back of the middle arm rest in the front, there are scratches on the back window, there is dirt on the back seat, there is dog hair in the pockets on the back of the front seats, there‚Äôs a scratch on one of the outside of the doors (not the imperfection stated already on the website), there are dirt marks on the inside of the boot and something sticky on the seatbelt sockets. The outside of the car was also not cleaned and I really expected this to be clean as a minimum. I did include images of all of the above in my original email to the experience team.

Aftersales Service is Dreadful : My initial experience with Cinch was brilliant, the Sales Team and everyone I spoken to before I purchased and took delivery of my car were so helpful, friendly and efficient.  However, the aftersales care is appalling!   You can never get an answer either on the phone of on the WhatsApp service - the message ALWAYS says 'We are currently receiving a high volume of calls etc'  So I tend to call the Sales Line, where you get an answer immediately and they can usually manage to speak to the relevant aftersales team, but it still takes 3 or 4 attempts to get anything resolved.   Very disappointing!

Would not recommend  : Had to chase all phone calls if I had not contacted them I would not have had my car sold. This sale took longer than I expected and had to get a new settlement figure because it took so long. Would not use this service again.

Audi A3 - Seamless experience! : Having always been a "traditional" car buyer i was a bit nervous purchasing a car having never physically seen it however the quality of the photos and pointing out any imperfections was really good. I missed out initially on the car i wanted as it was sold but i phoned (to make sure it was sold) and the lady in customer services was extremely helpful and suggested i saved my criteria on the website and register for automated notifications of new matches to my search criteria and also confirmed the process of part ex'ing my old car. I waited a few weeks and during that time got a few automated notifications by email for new matches upon which one of them i decided to buy. The deal breaker was that cinch were offering a good 1k more than anyone else for my park ex. From there the process of placing the purchase was very simple, akin to buying something from amazon!! A date for delivery was provided less than a week from purchase. I had multiple updates on email between purchase and delivery giving info on paper work needed prior to and on delivery day. On delivery day the driver dropped off my new car asked me to have a good look around and suggested i give it a test drive to familrise (which i skipped) then had a quick look around my part ex before exchanging paper work and thats it, done and dusted in less than 15 mins.. overall a really seamless experience and the new car is exactly what i wanted and hopefully it stays that way

Review_Title: I think the Car wow system is great - shame about shady motor traders, as per usual
Review_TitleAndText: I think the Car wow system is great - shame about shady motor traders, as per usual : I think the Car wow system is great. The support and check-ins I received from the team were helpful and I like the way this attempts to remove hassle from selling a car. However - like all things in life, it is spoiled when people in the process don't play ball. My buyer drove two hours to collect my car and even then tried to get ¬£300 knocked off as they said 'new' damage was on the alloys and a scratch was on the car. I rubbed the scratch off with my sleeve and I showed him the original photos of my alloys which showed small scratches. I called their bluff and in the end agreed to knock off ¬£100 as I just wanted rid of it. He openly admitted that because Motorway/Carwow charge ¬£400 to ¬£600, they try to recover this back at the PoS from the unwitting seller. Its really annoying and if it hadn't been for this I would have given 5 stars because the philosophy behind the model, and the systems you have set up are actually REALLY good. Its just there are always sharks in the water. :-|

Review_Title: Single staff member saved the day
Review_TitleAndText: Single staff member saved the day : Arrived and there were limited staff, someone said they would advise that I had arrived but 25 mins later no one had spoken to me, although I had overheard about redundancies so it made sense, employees were not happy so I get it.  I sorted your coffee machine out that had multiple errors (bad coffee btw), and finally found someone else who I updated that no one had spoken to me or acknowledged my arrival (Saima). It got better, she was polite and courteous and went to get my car. She arrived in my car and apologised for it not being very clean, most of the valet‚Äôs had not turned up, but she appreciated I was more knowledgeable that most buyers as I went over the car in detail. I found more issues than cazoo had stated on its defects page, but was happy enough to sign the car off knowing I have 14 days to return by law (not 7 as cazoo define on their site). Had a chat with Saima for a while and she got my service booked stamped (which cazoo techs had not done, I mean seriously‚Ä¶). So overall 3 star, it should have been a far better experience, but I don‚Äôt blame the staff, they were all very unhappy given their situation, but despite this I‚Äôd give Saima a 5*, she was the only shining light in the collection. She saved me from giving and overall 2*. Spending ¬£25k cash, I‚Äôd have expected a clean car and a better experience.

Even though all evidence has been submitted with technical reports they ask for more, but in order to do so this will cost me a further ¬£600 I simply can‚Äôt afford this and I‚Äôm sure a lot of you hard working people can‚Äôt ether so that‚Äôs how they get away with the scandal they provide.

Review_Title: Do not buy from this company!
Review_TitleAndText: Do not buy from this company! : This company is untrustworthy and totally ignorant to its customers, they lie about the work requited to fix the vehicle you've bought, don't answer emails or keep you waiting for nearly an hour on the phone! Not seen my vehicle now for over 9 weeks, the work is still pending, some of the problems haven't been looked at, as CINCH haven't told the garage about them, even though they have been reported in the warranty period, take your money and run, no aftercare or even a care for its customers, worst customer service ever! Won't ever use them again, and will pass on this reason to anyone one that ever asks about my experience with them! Useless company and terrible to deal with!

Review_Title: Sorted out a misunderstanding quickly and painlessly
Review_TitleAndText: Sorted out a misunderstanding quickly and painlessly  : I had originally written a bad review, because it appeared that Cinch would not pay for my car to be fixed after having had it for about 6 weeks. I received a call from a very nice and extremely helpful Customer Experience Agent. They sorted out the problem and have agreed to pay the dealer to fix the problem. I have completely changed my mind about Cinch and would definitely recommend them.

Review_Title: Quick delivery of the car I purchased‚Ä¶
Review_TitleAndText: Quick delivery of the car I purchased‚Ä¶ : Quick delivery of the car I purchased and the car i was part exchanging was taken away without issue.

Great delivery : Handover of my new car by Craig Sloan was smooth and he was very professional. Kept me up to date of when he would arrive and the car was as described. Great experience so far with cinch.

Misleading Imperfections List/Photos : They have an imperfections set of photographs which is good as you are buying online without seeing the car in person - but the car I ordered had no imperfection photos - I contacted them to ask why and they said there were no imperfections other than fair wear and tear.  So I went ahead and ordered the car - then my husband looked at the pictures of the inside in more detail and there was a clear hole in the passenger seat which looked like a cigarette burn.  I asked if they would clarify what this was and they said they would be able to let me know on Monday/Tuesday (this was Friday morning) the car was due to come in a few days time.  I also asked if it had a parcel shelf and was told it didnt - I said I thought that a cigarette burn on the passenger seat and a missing parcel shelf should be noted in the imperfections (and are not reasonable wear and tear for a 4 year old car) but they said the car is "sold as seen" I said yes - but on the basis of the information you provide and photos - and highlighting imperfections - as it isnt seen - its only viewed online - the 360 video had very dim lighting that made it difficult to see the hole in the seat.  I also then asked if I swapped cars if this would affect the finance as a hard search had now been made on my account and i was told I would have to cancel the order and re-apply which would generate a second hard search impacting my credit score.  I also had to wait literally hours on the online chat to resolve when I then chose to cancel my car.  There are many reviews on here saying a missing parcel shelf or items especially on the interior that were not picked up on the photos or highlighted on the imperfections - be very careful - yes you can return your car, but you now have a hard credit search on your account and its not that easy to just change it for another car.

Review_Title: Cinch, CinchCare and Tyler the legend.
Review_TitleAndText: Cinch, CinchCare and Tyler the legend. : Made a purchase of an MG ZS EV late December and delivered exactly when they said they would on Saturday 23rd Dec. Had the car for 4 months now and whilst there was a fault with the 12v battery they got it sorted no questions asked and very quickly. Had a query about my CinchCare when payments weren't taken and spoke to Tyler who sorted it quickly and efficiently. I Can highly recommend Cinch, CinchCare and Tyler! Customer care as it should be from an honest company. A pleasure to use their services and to recommend them.

Instructions clear and easy : The process is made really easy because Cinch send you all the instructions (e.g. how to tax your new vehicle, how to let the DVLA know that you‚Äôve sold your old one, etc.) by email which I found very useful because that is stuff I wouldn‚Äôt have otherwise known how to do.

Cinch then argued about this repair asking if it was necessary (if the car isn‚Äôt safe to drive clearly it‚Äôs warranted ) they then refused to repair the squeak asking bmw to clean it and place the exhaust actuator back in (no one told me it wasn‚Äôt a proper repair ) I was the. Eventually given an enterprise car whilst this happened 5 days in . And now I‚Äôm Told that cinch may not actually do .The repair atall even under warranty from them the lady at bmw is going to try and get them to approve this repair . Honestly I have spent countless hours on the phone crying emailing (not that cinch reply) to try and get this sorted this car was delivered with this issue and cinch take no accountability or issue no resolve for this . I am genuinely gutted it‚Äôs been 4 weeks and I‚Äôm yet to enjoy my car as I‚Äôm still trying

Both Front and Rear discs and pads were changed along with a missing brake sensor, brake fluid change, geometry check (including Front and rear toe adjustment), precision wheel balance and crosland cabin filter!! For a total cost of ¬£1,090.00, in only 4 weeks of owning the vehicle!!

Review_Title: Not a good experience and car not sold
Review_TitleAndText: Not a good experience and car not sold : Used Motorway as recommended by another company I was working with. The initial valuation was painless. But was followed up by tons of emails wanting you to progress the sale. I decided to take it further and answered all the questions I could on website. Then had to download the app to provide photos of the car, including defects. In itself that is fine, but once that was done the app becomes useless. I got a call to say that the reserve price would be ¬£250 less that the initial valuation. The car has relatively low milage and is 13 years old so it would be a surprise if there were no marks or scratches. I mentioned that I needed the car for a further week, and they said that they would note that. The car went up for auction and the price bid was higher than the reserve price. I then got a message from the dealer to collect the car the next day and had to point out that we needed the car to the following Saturday and Motorway were aware of this. Then I didn't hear anything from dealer. Chased them on the Thursday and was told the inspection team would contact me the next afternoon. That didn't happen. Chased again on Friday. Was told that the inspection team would come around Saturday afternoon and I would get an hour's notice of their arrival. So spent all Saturday afternoon waiting. Got a text saying that the inspector would arrive before 6:30pm. Then got a call from the dealer shortly before 6pm saying that the inspector was on his way, but his finance team had made a mistake on the bid and would call me back in 5 minutes. Got the call back and was told that the correct bid was ¬£2,000 less than the actual amount they bid. I didn't sell at that price (fortunately I wasn't under any pressure to sell the car at any cost) but got the impression that if I had gone with the 'lower' bid then they would have been happy to come around and collect the car.  So not a great experience and you are at the mercy of the bidder. Looking through the reviews there are some bad ones, which is a shame.
KeyPhrases: inspection team would come around saturday afternoon
