Buyers beware!!  : I‚Äôve waited a while before submitting my review in order to give Cinch time to sort out my issue. I purchased my car based on their sales details on the cinch website, the car arrived on the day that I asked for, the guy that delivered the car was friendly and explained the controls etc, the car wasn‚Äôt as clean as I expected either inside or out, it was explained to me that as it had been driven from Corby I would have to accept that it wouldn‚Äôt be clean, it even had white marker pen on the windows highlighting where it was stored in their compound!! I pointed out a couple of scratches on the door and was told by him that these could be polished out! I notified customer services as I found multiple scratches all over the car, none of these were highlighted on the imperfections‚Äô section on the car‚Äôs details, only two scratches on the alloy wheel!! If they had put these down I wouldn‚Äôt have purchased the car!  Initially customers services were okay, they asked me to take pictures of all the scratches with a tape measure as they will only look at ones over 25mm, ALL of the scratches measured well over this!!  I was told that this has been passed onto the Technical department and I have had no contact since then. I am MOST unhappy and totally disappointed when I received my ¬£17,000 car to find it wasn‚Äôt as advertised on the website. I feel that I have been totally misled in to purchasing a car that I wouldn‚Äôt have if I‚Äôd known that it had multiple scratches all over it! I WOULD DEFINITELY NOT TRUST WHAT THEY SAY ON THE WEBSITE, it‚Äôs definitely pot luck that you get what they say! I will be taking this matter further with both the ombudsman and the advertising agency. Cinch knew about all the imperfections on this car as they had been highlighted on a inspection report done by the previous owner but chose not to put them in their sales description!!  Motto of this story, do not buy what you have not inspected before hand!! I won‚Äôt be making this mistake again!!

Absolute nightmare customer experience - avoid! : Bought a Volvo XC90 for ¬£32k just over 6 months ago. Latest issue - whilst in Volvo main dealer for other work during 3 month warranty period, Volvo did a full health check and advised that the Hybrid system had failed. Cazoo declined to cover the work. Car subsequently broke down on the motorway with hybrid system gearbox and clutch complete failure. This resulted in a ¬£3500 bill that Cazoo are still disputing. Customer service are impossible to get hold of - I've now emailed them 12 times, tried their "live chat" twice, and spent a total of over 11 hours on hold awaiting someone in Cazoo to authorise the payment to Volvo. Every time I manage to get through I get fobbed off with "because it's a large amount of money it has to be escalated to a supervisor" - which never happens. They've now had the bill for 4 weeks and I've been without a car for 6 weeks in total. Avoid at all costs as I'm going to have to pay the bill myself and I will be recovering the cost from Cazoo via small claims court.

Review_Title: Sold a faulty car and Cazoo won‚Äôt help
Review_TitleAndText: Sold a faulty car and Cazoo won‚Äôt help : Bought a car in August ‚Äò23. Within a few days we realised there was a slow leak in the tyre. Obviously, that could have happened since we had it, so we didn‚Äôt think that much of it. Then something went wrong with the brakes and we were told they were incredibly worn. Don't sound desperate to sell... : I had a mixed experience with the car selling process. While I did manage to sell my car through this service, I found that their valuations were overestimated, which can mislead the customer. When I tried to get the value of my car, the estimated range was ¬£13500 - ¬£14100. Based on this, I listed my car for sale. However, when they called me, they said the valuation was only ¬£12773, which was significantly lower than the estimated range for a car that had no issues, low mileage and a perfect record. My car didn't sell, and they later called me with a final offer of ¬£12000. I was confused because I never received any initial offers, so I wondered how ¬£12000 could be my final offer. Something seemed off to me.

A really silly and serious error made by Cinch. Turns out it‚Äôs a leak in coolant. Having to drive around with water in car to keep refilling it. Cinch supposed to be getting a Ford garage to fix it. 1 week on still no garage booking. I‚Äôve now lost a weeks worth of work being self employed waiting on day for car to go in. What‚Äôs more disturbing is I feel it‚Äôs being dragged out to go past my 14 day money back guarantee. Luckily for me my last email on stated a refund if I hadn‚Äôt heard back from them keeping me in within my 14 day money back guarantee. Still currently waiting from them! Review_Title: if you get a car with problems good luck getting the issues resolved
Review_TitleAndText: if you get a car with problems good luck getting the issues resolved : Bought a car from cinch back in mid february,whithin 10 minutes of driving the car the engine management light came on so returned home to phone Cinch.Also i noticed the stop start wasnt working and a couple of bits wasnt quite right which i have also reported.After spending over an hour and half trying to get through i tried the Whatsapp chat and eventually getting through i was told someone wold be in touch to resolve the issues. Some days later i was contacted to say it would be going in to be looked at but would be five weeks to wait. so after contacting a garage who said it is no good for a car to be driven for that long with the eml light on i tried to contact Cinch to return the car surprise surprise was just on hold for well over an hour so emailed instead.so on the day the car was meant to go into the garage i was meant to have a hire car but when it got to lunchtime no one turned up so phoned cinch and surprise surprise took over an hour to get through to be told that a mobile van was coming out to have a look and guess what the van never turned up. i phoned the garage where the car was meant to be booked into and they had no knowledge of the car being booked in.i have tried to email to return the car a couple of times because i dont have the time to spend hours on the phone but get no reply.the car has also broken down and left me stranded because the battery died which i did report to them. this review is just the edited highlights,my whole experiance has been a total nightmare and Cinch should be very ashamed as i feel its absolutely disgusting how they have treated me. unless you manage to get a car without any problems avoid as customer service is an absolute discrace.

Review_TitleAndText: Easy, smooth process and quick from start to finish!  : This was the first time selling a car without trading it in and given how seamless the process was, I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to use motorway again. You‚Äôre guided through every step and it‚Äôs all free! The estimate (reserve price) before dealers bid on the car when it goes live, was based on an immaculate vehicle without even a scratch or paint chips anywhere (which our was) and so we ended up getting a little extra than the reserve price. The process takes out all the people contacting you with questions and once we‚Äôd accepted the price with the garage dealer, we arranged inspection to confirm the vehicle was as described, then the bank transfer went through within minutes. Algorithm valuation, under true value.  : My car is Low mileage, showroom condition, full service history, and ¬£4k worth of extras so I should get a great price? Carwow decided the reserve price MUST be ¬£1000 below the true value, because the computer takes an average sale price from past cars sold, none of which were a good as mine. The offers started with 4 dealers all bidding against each other. But as soon as the reserve was reached they all stopped. Why? Because when a dealer sees a reserve is set low, the dealer thinks that is the price you are happy to accept, and that is the price YOU value your car at. The value of my car was set by a computer algorithm not a human.

Review_Title: What a waste of time and effort
Review_TitleAndText: What a waste of time and effort : I got a decent valuation and decided to accept the best offer and started to upload the required photographs and documents which Carwow say will only take 10 minutes!After spending a couple of hours doing this,I got to the stage where everything was complete except for proof of ownership,eg a sales receipt or invoice.I explained by 2 E-mails that I didn't have anything but all I got was another E-mail asking for the same, so I rang the help line and was told that was ok and not to worry about it.36 hours later another E-mail arrived again making the same request but now also asking for proof of my address so I rang the help line again and explained it all again.I was told again that it was ok but still needed proof of my address such as utiluty bill or bank statement but I explained that I had neither as I did everything on line and anyway this was never a reqirement in the original list of necessary documents.I was told that it was because I had supplied passport details instead of driving licence even though a passport was listed as acceptable.The person then told me ,in the same sentence, that passport details were both acceptable and not acceptable! At this point I had had enough and cancelled the whole deal which has now cost me about ¬£1400 as I will probably have to take the part exchange deal I have been offered against a new car.

I was shocked, I‚Äôd paid nearly double that for the car almost a year ago. I refused their offer and they called their manager and came back with a second offer of nearly ¬£6.5k. By this time I was extremely intimidated, anxious and felt completely backed into a corner so I reluctantly agreed to the sale. Less than 24hrs later and the car is for sale for ¬£10k!!  Dealers should not be allowed to haggle unless there are major defects and the profile is completely misleading. Clear and concise valuation. : Clear and concise valuation.

STAY AWAY : If I can describe Cazoo in 2 words it would be "Complete incompetence". My partner and I bought a car with them in September 2023. We reported a fault that became apparent a couple of weeks after. It is now March 2024 and it has yet to be resolved. We have travelled to their Chertsey service centre 4 times. Twice where they did nothing since they did not have a part. But the last occasion takes tops it off with unacceptable levels of incompetence. We arrived at the appointed time, and went about our day but when we returned expecting to get a car that has had a clutch replaced. It turns out that the clutch was never ordered and nobody thought to tell us before we came to collect. The mechanic, although apologetic, said that they had reported the issue to customer service and that they had promised to call but that never happened. Mr. Mechanic said to call the customer service centre but surprise, we've been doing that for the past 6 months and they never have the live chat (which they blatantly boast about in the call waiting line) nor the phone lines manned and have regularly been on hold for more than an hour. They can't do anything about it in the centre because it is "a separate system and is just not possible". This is not even the first time this has happened. They fail to book appointments or order parts more than once and don't communicate any of this to us until it is too late. When we do get through to someone on the phone you get referred and ping ponged through a variety of different departments with no accountability or action being done. Even when they do get a booking done, it is always "sorry we are fully booked for the next month" and only after a lot of faff and arguing that we get an earlier appointment which is still usually within a few weeks.  We've spent hours on the phone lines (and even this instance they did not pick up and will need to call them back on Monday, again spending another few hours on the phone), hours driving back and forth to and from the service centre and spent more than a few hundred quid out of pocket. We have even paid for the extended warrantee. We have run out of patience.

Review_Title: Selling my car through Motorway was‚Ä¶
Review_TitleAndText: Selling my car through Motorway was‚Ä¶ : Selling my car through Motorway was incredibly smooth. I'd definitely advise others to use their service! Plus, I got a much better price compared to selling it back to Audi. Initially, I doubted how genuine the process was because of its effortless nature and lack of obligations, but it exceeded my expectations.

Yesterday wasn't faff free : Sold 3 cars on motorway now most have been relatively easy, yesterday the collection driver was ace but took over a hour due to the garage been unnecessary hard. Felt like they were trying to find issues with the car (none found) and we left 3/4 of a tank of fuel, we had a warning for adblue too (needed refill in 1534) it was in the pictures. The garage wanted that topping up, another ¬£25. Missed other appointments yesterday due to them been painfully hard.

The process went very smoothly : The process went very smoothly. I had to make some adjustments after I had agreed to sell but this was dealt with quickly and fairly. I would sell again through Motorway

Easy-to-follow process, smooth transaction  : Easy-to-follow process, the whole transaction was very smooth and quick (under a week from initial listing to car being picked up) and really happy with the price achieved for the vehicle.
Straight forward easy to follow :

Motorway itself was easy and‚Ä¶ : Motorway itself was easy and straightforward, the platform made selling the car stress-free. Afterwards, the company that was meant to collect the car didn't turn up the first time and then when they did turn up offered 75% of the agreed price. I'd rather sell direct next time and get what the car is worth.

Review_TitleAndText: Easiest way to buy a car : I didn't realise it would be so easy to buy a car from home. I didn't need to visit any garage or showroom to choose a car. I have selected it from home. Cinch has delivered it to my home. I had 14 days to drive the car and decide whether to keep the car or return it. My experience is Cinch checks the used car quality thoroughly and then only make it available for sale. I had a great experience buying a car. If I have to buy again I will choose cinch again. The delivery guy was very generous and punctual.

So simple : Really easy process - quick, simple and my shiny new car arrived right on time! I usually hate the experience of buying cars; the macho, patronising, patter and a general sense of somehow being "done up like a kipper", this genuinely was a cinch!

Review_Title: The car should have been delivered‚Ä¶
Review_TitleAndText: The car should have been delivered‚Ä¶ : The car should have been delivered between 08.00 and 13.00 but in fact arrived at  around 17.30. Due to transport/driver issues.

Excellent service  : Very easy process, even the finance was easy to navigate. Car delivered as arranged. There was an issue with my Autoglym welcome package and this was resolved with very little effort on my part. Pack arrived and guarantee registered. Would recommend to my family and friends üòÄüòÄ
ATROCIOUS CUSTOMER SERVICE! : If there is an issue with your car, CINCH customer service don't care.

Car bought back in June : Car bought back in June. Lots of extra damage, put down as wear and tear. No service history. Which was never supplied even after continual contact and asking for it.   When the winter rolled round it showed up a busted seal on the passenger door which was letting in water.  Just put this three year old car in for it's first MOT and it failed.  Quite incredible. Trouble with headlight electrics.  So all in all I cannot recommend this lacklustre lazy joke of a company that delivers cars with more damage than advertised, then offers no after sales help whatsoever.  I gave up contacting them in the end because they plainly couldn't care less about after sales.  So buyer beware dealing with these people.  They are bad.  Just saying like it is so maybe you don't have a terrible experience like I have had.

Great team : First of all, car is fantastic. However, it look me an hour to get through to phone lines to track my delivery to discover there had been a delay and my delivery was changed to an afternoon slot after booking the morning. However, I spoke to Bal Dosanj from the Cinch team and he sorted out my problem for me with a gesture of goodwill, which I appreciate. Thank you very much
Nicest delivery driver!  : Pardeep Singh our delivery driver was great!

Mixed feelings. : What I disliked was that I found it near impossible to speak to anyone on the telephone and had to rely on inadequate email responses which sometimes took days to arrive. That is, until I spoke to Liam Basquette in Sales. Within a very short time he had digested what my problem was. Understood what the problem was and swiftly came up with a solution. He was a gem and everything that one hopes for with Customer Care. He had to consult with a Manager or Managers but the amount of time I had to wait on the phone was minimal. If Liam had dealt with my problem from the outset, my review rating would be five stars without a shadow of a doubt. It was the poor quality Care beforehand that caused me to give a 3 star rating. If only there were more attentive personnel like Liam then Cinch would definitely be on a winner.
Great service : Great service, car exactly as described. Really quick responses to email and chat.

I received a call from driver stating they were 10 minutes away but 5 minutes later they called again to advise that upon using the wipers the cars windscreen had been damaged and the car could no longer be delivered. Since then I was advised on the day it would be booked into a garage on the Tuesday to have the repairs done but yesterday I was told they were still waiting on costing before anything could be done. I am now paying for a vehicle for a car I have never even seen in person and I have been left without a time frame for this. I have emailed last night but no response as of yet I would expect to be given a new delivery date by the end of the week as this is not a overtly complex repair. And would appreciate some contact

Cazoo reply to emails when they feel like it. Asked if I could exchange for a different car as had enough now and got radio silence. Even said I would agree a fair amount decution for milage against this faulty one - ignored me. Now raised this through my finance company as this has being going on since October! Honestly, just go to a local dealer. It's not worth the hassle. This is making me suffer mentally and they just dont care.

Review_Title: I do not recommend cinch at all
Review_TitleAndText: I do not recommend cinch at all : I do not recommend cinch at all. I had a car from cinch in August 2023 and have had alot of issues, some only minor but things keep going wrong with it. Firstly, after a few days I realised that the usb port doesn‚Äôt work but wasn‚Äôt too bothered about it. Secondly, I saw that the temperature gauge for the car was getting very hot, very quickly. When I checked the coolant tank, it was bone dry, again I just thought it hadn‚Äôt been filled like it was supposed to be but now I‚Äôm concerned it may have caused some damage. Another thing is the touchscreen on the dab radio is very temperamental, having to tap on it several times before it registers. There‚Äôs a clunk sound when the car is reversing and I was never told that it requires ad-blue. Nowhere in the car specs,does it say, it needs ad-blue. It wasn‚Äôt until the alarm sounded and light flashed that I became aware of this. Sent an email to them in March but they didn‚Äôt get in touch apart from automated messages so I rang customer service and they said it‚Äôs out of warranty so they aren‚Äôt going to do anything about it and that all diesel cars require ad blue and I should know this. Not happy at all. Yes the car was out of warranty but a few issues during warranty that I wish now I did report and bigger issues just out of warranty. Now got to pay over ¬£400 to fix just some of the issues.

Our experience was hassle free : Our experience was hassle free, our car was brought to our door by a pleasant and friendly young man who dealt with paperwork within a short time. It couldn‚Äôt have been easier.
Very lovely guy : Very lovely guy. Chatty and explained lots.
Collection driver terrific. : Collection driver .

Some honest feedback for Carwow : A free and fairly straight-forward process with helpful staff and you seem to use a good class of Main dealer buyers.  However, I've sold a few now with you so I'll give you my honest thoughts on how to make the process better for the seller.  First off is the price that you suggest based on the information supplied never seems to be what the real person says it's worth.  I'd understand this if the cars sold were weaker than their description but in my case I've sold four cars, all very nearly new, most with lots of factory extras and not one stone chip or mark between them, yet each time the real person says its worth less than what you quote moments earlier.  Second is the process of the Auction.  You used to show each bid as it came in and notify me and if the reserve was not met it allowed me the option to accept an offer.  You've changed this and now we only see if there has been any offer at all after the auction closes.  I can understand there may be issues with telling me which business has bid but it would be nice to know that bids were coming in as it gets you to feel more involved in the process and the new system for me is less enjoyable.  The final point I'd make is that it would be good for you to have code of conduct with each buyer so they know what is expected from them.  I've sold at least four cars with you and the dealers are usually top notch.  Communicative and professional.  The last one was not.  I suspect this was down to him being in the role for days rather than years but communication was very poor meaning that settlement took much longer than it needed to.  Overall score 8/10

Don‚Äôt waste your time : Don‚Äôt waste your time. I had taken my car into the lakeside branch for a quote to buy my car and its initial checks. I accepted the price even though some money was knocked off for a small dent that I, nor anyone else I asked could see. A few days later I took the car back for its mechanical checks and a different man was working so I mentioned the dent that couldn‚Äôt be seen and once he had looked he agreed there wasn‚Äôt a dent. Off the car went to be checked over and to my surprise when he came back he reported there were a number of problems with the car. Firstly this invisible dent had re appeared, then apparently the bumper had been damaged, badly repaired and re sprayed and finally the passenger door had been badly damaged and ‚Äútwisted out of shape‚Äù and again badly repaired because the door lines don‚Äôt match up. I have had the car from new it‚Äôs in excellent condition and it has never been in an accident or damaged and repaired in anyway. So either their inspectors are terrible at their job and don‚Äôt know what they are doing or liars. It must be both either way don‚Äôt use them they completely wasted our time. I wouldn‚Äôt even give them one star but trust pilot don‚Äôt allow you to give them a zero.

The whole experience is much better than I expected and Motorway did deliver what they promised. I am a very happy customer and would highly recommend it to anyone who would like to sell their cars.

Review_Title: Very easy process from start to finish
Review_TitleAndText: Very easy process from start to finish :

Caveat emptor : I have two key recommendations for anyone considering purchasing a car from this company. First, personally pick up your vehicle instead of opting for delivery. This gives you the chance to thoroughly inspect the car and the freedom to walk away if needed. Second, conduct a meticulous inspection before signing any documents. Although the pre-sale process was efficient, our post-sale experience was incredibly frustrating and quite terrible.  We discovered mould under the centre armrest and, with all the doors and windows shut, a very strong and pervasive smell of cigarette smoke.  Neither were spotted before handover (it was inspected with all the doors open, and who looks under the centre armrest when being rushed through a PDI?).  Our attempts to immediately address these issues with the company were met with long wait times on calls (up to 45 mins) and e-mails going unanswered.  Using their Digital Assistant/WhatsApp elicited a limited and unhelpful response (ie, an offer of ¬£25 to have it cleaned), a stark contrast to the prompt pre-sales service.  I wanted to return the car but personal (medical) circumstances meant I could not do so in their timescale and after eventually being able to talk to a person, I stupidly agreed to having it re-valeted at their expense.  Even getting to that point was a painful exercise.  Eventually that was agreed, but only with a relatively modest budget.  This has only resolved the mould issue (although the staining is still there), the smoke odour returned within 10 days.  As a result, my wife will not use the car and we cannot take the grandkids in it (what are they breathing?), so two months down the line it sits unloved and unwanted on the drive.  It is diminishing in value and our ability to resell it.  Our oversight in not inspecting the car more rigorously upon delivery was a mistake on our part but in our defence, we already have an identical model and didn‚Äôt need to know about all the bells and whistles; you just don‚Äôt expect such issues.  This experience has turned us off from online car purchases in the future.  It's clear that while the pre-sale service is excellent, the post-sale support is lacking, with every effort being made to not enable that to happen and limited recourse available to customers once issues arise.  If you do find you want to return your car after delivery, be prepared for extremely long telephone wait times and stick to your guns.

Review_Title: Long read but worth it. Information I wish I had.
Review_TitleAndText: Long read but worth it. Information I wish I had. : Long read but worth it! It‚Äôs cliche but REALLY wished I read and payed attention to the reviews on here. Cinch customer service is the WORSE I‚Äôve ever experienced, and that‚Äôs not an exaggeration. The company focus their efforts on new Sales, and that‚Äôs why if you happen to get the vehicle you ordered and don‚Äôt need any follow up customer service, then you‚Äôll likely have a very good experience. The struggles begin where you receive a vehicle that doesn‚Äôt match the description or there is something wrong that wasn‚Äôt made clear on the website. Firstly, be prepared to be on hold for upwards of 45mins just to speak to someone. I‚Äôve been on hold for over one hour then the call dropped with no answer. That‚Äôs an hour I won‚Äôt get back! Secondly, be prepared for days before any response to email. Contrary to what they say on the website, they don‚Äôt respond within 24hrs or 48hrs for that matter. Thirdly, no response at all via WhatsApp - it‚Äôs an autobot feature - not real persons responding to you. I was so frustrated that I had to call the new Sales line to get help. And not surprisingly, someone answered on the 2nd ring, compared to holding over 1 hour on the customer support line!! Fourthly, when the issues I initially raised were finally picked up, some were acknowledged that they would resolve, some they said they wouldn‚Äôt. One of the issues was around severe corrosion of the brakes and discs. I took pictures the day after I received the vehicle (received it in the evening before) and sent via email. I was advised days later to take the vehicle to Halfords for a free break check. The report came back that the brakes and discs were excessively corroded and needed to be changed. Days went by and no proper response to the report from Halfords. I felt I was being ignored! When I finally got a response 4 days later I was told they need to send someone to look at the vehicle because the pictures I sent weren‚Äôt clear. Why wasn‚Äôt this done from the very beginning when I raised the issue??? At this point the 14 day trial period is nearly ending, plus I had no further response to another issue I had initially raised to which they said they would resolve it. At this point I felt I was being given the runaround and these issues were being intentionally dragged out to increase the costs I‚Äôm already incurring, so I might be more likely to keep the vehicle. I had lost all confidence in Cinch and decided to return the vehicle right away. Which brings me to the final point. What they don‚Äôt tell you on the website is that the process takes longer than 14days, and you can end up spending upwards of ¬£300, depending on the vehicle. That‚Äôs expensive just to test drive a vehicle when you can go to a physical dealership and test drive for FREE!!!! You have to tax the vehicle and pay for insurance for those 21 days - it takes a further week for them to come and collect the vehicle from you if you decide to return it - for which you have to keep the vehicle insured. The information on the website doesn‚Äôt make this clear up front and I will raise a formal complaint with the Ombudsman or FCA. It isn‚Äôt as simple and straightforward as they make it out to be. It‚Äôs not clear on the costs you should expect to cover and how much this could potentially be!!! A word to Cinch, please don‚Äôt respond with your robotic answer to this review. My matter is closed and there‚Äôs nothing you are going to do to resolve. If you were intent to help, you would have helped me resolve it at the time. Please, please improve your post sale customer or aftercare service!

Better than WBAC! : The initial valuation from Motorway for my BMW Z4 was more than other car-buying companies so decided to go with them (despite their awful TV adverts). Filling out Motorway's selling form was a bit tricky as you had to use their app to take pictures rather than contribute your own and their app didn't like the fact that the Z4 didn't have rear seats and was an open top! However having mastered the app and put the car up for sale I was pleasantly surprised to eventually get an offer which was more than Motorway's initial valuation and ¬£3000 more than Webuyanycar's! The dealer who purchased the Z4 duly arrived at the time he said he would and after inspecting the car transferred the cash by BACS on the spot and whisked it away on his car carrier. The whole transaction was swift and hassle free and I got the same amount for the car as Autotrader suggested I would if I sold it privately - all without the possible pitfalls associated with private selling. Would recommend Motorway following my experience of using them.

Buyer beware : Buyer beware. Cazoo do some things well; the handover was a smooth and pleasant experience (thank you, Alan) and the initial response to my concerns was fairly swift and positive. However, the way do they do business is underhand, dishonest and borderline fraudulent. How it works is to list features and a higher spec than you are likely to receive, knowing that many will simply accept they haven‚Äôt got all they hoped but will keep the car anyway as they enjoy it. This way the value is inflated and more interest garnered. Another sinister practise is the one of advertising a 7 day grace period in which you can return the car when the legal period is 14 days, something which is mentioned way down in their terms and conditions. On top of this, the warranty period is 90 days as opposed to the 12 months you‚Äôll mostly find elsewhere which suggests little confidence in their stock. You may find what you‚Äôre looking for and all may be well but, please, be diligent and make absolutely sure you‚Äôll be getting all that you‚Äôre expecting. Edit: despite initial overtures Cazoo have now ghosted me, along with many others. It is rumoured they‚Äôre going bust and it‚Äôs unlikely any issues  will be resolved. I urge you not to take the risk, it‚Äôs not worth it.

Review_TitleAndText: Buying the car was simple and easy : Buying the car was simple and easy. The car matched the description with no additional damage. After getting in touch with Cinch they said they'd get it booked in with a nearby garage and I should hear something within 48 hours. After the 48 hours I'd still not heard anything so got back in touch with Cinch who then told me the garage had actually rejected the booking as the next slot they had was over 2 weeks in the future. They then tried to book my car in at garage over an hour away which was completely unfeasible so I turned that down. I'm now stuck waiting over 3 weeks before someone can even look at my car let alone fix it. Very poor after sales service and has put me off buying from Cinch again

Review_Title: Cinch make car buying extremely easy
Review_TitleAndText: Cinch make car buying extremely easy : Cinch are great people to deal with from start to finish. Jessica Regan in Customer Finance was very helpful as was Rudi Ginsberg in Customer Experience. However top marks go to delivery driver Jamie (aka Jahy) who was very polite, courteous and knowledgeable and to Joseph Brown (Customer Relations Executive) who sorted out my problems which had made me score an initial 4 star review. The reasons for the 4 stars not 5 were on 2 points. Firstly there was a number written on the windscreen in some sort of pen / paint which took some difficulty to fully scratch it off by myself with a sharp knife. This should surely come as removed as standard when the car is delivered rather than asking the customer to remove it. Secondly the car came with no front car mats. Once Joseph had contacted me following my review he agreed to a good will gesture for the windscreen issue and to re-imburse me for my car mats which he said i should have expected to have had in a car that new. I am therefore changing the review to 5 stars as i am now happy that Cinch have gone above and beyond to deal with my 2 issues

Review_Title: !!!DO NOT BUY FROM CARWOW AS A DEALERSHIP!!
Review_TitleAndText: !!!DO NOT BUY FROM CARWOW AS A DEALERSHIP!! : Review: CARWOW - A Frustrating Experience for DealershipsAs a dealership that has engaged extensively with CARWOW over the past few months, our experience has been marred by frustration and a sense of being taken advantage of. We've purchased over 100 cars through the platform, but we've also had to reject numerous vehicles due to misleading sellers and undisclosed issues.The fundamental issue lies in CARWOW's prioritization of customer protection over supporting buyers like us. It's a rare occurrence to find a platform where the scales tip so heavily in favor of customers, to the detriment of those actually footing the bills - us, the buyers.Rejecting vehicles with undisclosed mechanical or bodywork issues, while essential to protect our profit margins, has led to repercussions from CARWOW. We've been confronted with what can only be described as a form of blackmail. CARWOW has threatened us and other dealers with suspension, citing our 'high' cancellation rate as grounds for punitive action.What CARWOW fails to understand is that in our line of work, such rejection rates are par for the course. We cannot afford to invest in faulty vehicles, especially those that have already been rejected by other platforms like 'We Buy Any Car'. It's not just about preserving our margins; it's about maintaining our integrity as a dealership.The most egregious aspect of this experience is CARWOW's willingness to manipulate situations to secure their fees. They suspend accounts for failing to purchase vehicles, pushing sellers to seek alternatives and essentially punishing us for our caution.Moreover, CARWOW's tactics result in tangible financial losses for us. We're left covering transportation costs for vehicles we ultimately reject due to misrepresentation by sellers. It's not uncommon for us to book inspections and transport, only to discover undisclosed issues upon closer examination.CARWOW's practices have reached a point where they're not just frustrating; they're outright damaging to businesses like ours. The recent suspension of our account, coupled with the loss of transportation deposits and disrupted seller relationships, highlights the lack of consideration for our operational realities.In conclusion, we at Supreme Motor Group have reached our limit with CARWOW. The platform's blatant disregard for dealer concerns and transparent pursuit of profits at our expense is no longer tolerable. We're opting out and recommending other dealerships to steer clear, directing them instead towards more balanced platforms like MOTORWAY, which prioritize fairness and integrity over profit margins.CARWOW's attempts to emulate successful models like MOTORWAY have fallen short, and until significant changes are made, we stand by our decision to sever ties with this platform.Sincerely, Supreme Motor Group
KeyPhrases: discover undisclosed issues upon closer examination

Review_TitleAndText: This is my 4th car from cinch and the‚Ä¶ : This is my 4th car from cinch and the final car from cinch! Got my car delivered mid February time, when it arrived it had a warning light already lit up on the dashboard (tyre pressure sensors had failed) 3/4 weeks later another warning light popped up on the dashboard (SOS Failure). Arranged for the car to be booked into bmw (cinch chose the place not me) took it into bmw on the 3rd of April to then find out they cinch are refusing to pay for what needs to be done (car is well under the 90 day warranty) to this day my car is still at bmw with cinch still refusing to pay for the damage. Avoid this company at all costs, go with cazoo which I‚Äôve heard is better service. Absolutely disgusting company to buy from.

Review_Title: Quick and easy process, would definitely use again.
Review_TitleAndText: Quick and easy process, would definitely use again. : The process was easy from start to finish and the staff who greeted me on the day couldn‚Äôt have been more helpful.

Please avoid at all costs. : In September 2023, I bought my car from Cazoo on finance, using my old car as a part ex. On the second week of having the car, I had issues with the clutch sticking down and having to be forced up by hand, but considered this a ‚Äúone off‚Äù, as of course, Cazoo had assured me they did a 300 point check, which had no mention of the clutch. This happened once more during the 3 month warranty period. Around 5 days after the warranty ended, the clutch got totally stuck as I was driving uphill, causing me to roll backwards and almost cause a collision. I had to stop on the hill and get out of the car to force the clutch back up, in the middle of traffic. Clearly not a ‚Äúone off‚Äù, so I looked up the issue online and found a bunch of people saying the same thing, that it‚Äôs a known manufacturer fault, which was the cause of a lot of recalls in 2019. I emailed Cazoo, asking for their help and to explain how a known manufacturer fault can possibly get past their ‚Äúextensive‚Äù checks. After 8 days, I got a reply which essentially said to contact the manufacturer and that Cazoo can‚Äôt help. Zero explanation or advice other than this. I followed up to reiterate my question of how they can sell me a car with such an issue, but so far I‚Äôve had no response at all. I sent that email on 16th December 2023, and have chased it up twice, and nothing. After looking into selling the car and realising I would have to pay extra towards the finance settlement myself (despite a ¬£4k deposit), I raised a case with the motor ombudsmen‚Ä¶ only for the ombudsmen to respond advising that Cazoo is not accredited. Why would a company with such a big customer base NOT be accredited to the ombudsmen? So, in this case, I‚Äôve lost money and am left with a faulty car. MOT is due in a couple of weeks and no doubt that will be costing me as well. Disgusting company to not even offer me an explanation, they literally could not care less about their customers. All seems pretty great at first when they‚Äôre selling you the car, but doesn‚Äôt last too long after that. Please just avoid at all costs, I wish I‚Äôd have read reviews beforehand.

Great customer service : Customer service was great whether through WhatsApp or in person on the phone. Review_Title: Excellent customer service and buying experience
Review_TitleAndText: Excellent customer service and buying experience : After a bad experience with Cazoo, we gave cinch a try. From start to finish the whole experience has been exceptional. The customer service picked up the phone within about 3-4 minutes and they were all friendly and

Fantastic online process : From start to finish everything integrated amazingly. You may think the online experience might not work in practical terms, but it does. You don‚Äôt need to travel many miles to view cars advertised elsewhere only to be disappointed by their condition. Cinch have so many cars you can choose the exact model & spec you want, within reason. Their description is comprehensive & includes any imperfections which turned out to be minor & as described. The car was delivered saving me more time, & handed over professionally by Rudi in a clean, presentable condition, better than I expected. On top of all this I thought their prices are just about right.

Brilliant : Starting off, the Cinch website is straightforward and easy to use. Allowing you to select makes, models, and vehicle types. So if you are unsure on what car you have in mind (like I was), there is an easy and accessible variety on the website. Payment was easy, and I could have had the car as quickly as 4 days from ordering. However as I work full time, weekends suit better, and it was delivered when I asked promptly during the time slot. It was delivered by Ian Neil, a really friendly and informative bloke that showed me around the car and answered any questions I had. It was me who asked if I could leave him a review as he was so helpful and prompt. Great way to finalise the deal with Cinch. Car is lovely also, couldn‚Äôt be happier with it. Every minor imperfection was highlighted before purchase and upon scouring the car for damage, there is absolutely nothing else to report.

Review_Title: I ordered a car from Cinch‚Ä¶
Review_TitleAndText: I ordered a car from Cinch‚Ä¶ : I ordered a car from Cinch recently,costing ¬£6800. It was due to be delivered 8 days from the date of my order. I had a call from them on the day of delivery around 1pm,saying that my electric car has had issues and won‚Äôt be delivered today. I said I haven‚Äôt ordered an electric car. He apologized and said that he would get back to me. 2 hours later someone else called and apologized for her colleague. Saying he had got it wrong. And the delivery driver had problems, and was unable to deliver. I rearranged delivery for 2 days later. On that day I got a call saying that the engine management light had come on an hour into the journey. 3 hours later I had an email saying that the car had issues with the cam belt. And was being returned. All this has caused me a lot of stress. I wish I never got involved with Cinch in the first place. What a shambles. I obviously cancelled my order. I‚Äôm not paying nearly ¬£7000 for a rubbish car. And I‚Äôve sent several emails without reply,asking for my refund. Of which I haven‚Äôt received yet. Please avoid buying anything from Cinch. My experience has been awful. My order number CI-6MWM29-987QVX. Mr Gibbons

Review_TitleAndText: I was offered ¬£7000 trade in, got ¬£8741 on carwow  : I was offered ¬£7000 as a trade in for a new car, I didn‚Äôt agree with that, but I also hate private selling as it‚Äôs full of scammers and tyre kickers! So as I‚Äôve used carwow to find the best deal on my new car I thought I‚Äôd see how the selling on it worked. I uploaded the pics it told me to, all very simple once it stopped raining for 10 mins! I got a call the next day confirming it all and awaited the auction on BH Monday. At 3:30 that day the auction ended and I got a bid of ¬£8791, well happy! a couple of days past without word but then after a nudge from carwow the buyer came to collect my car. They did try to knock off ¬£100 more but we agreed ¬£50 so I received ¬£8741 direct into my account, I handed over the keys and it was driven off. I got my new car the next day. Great way of selling IMO

Review_Title: Motorway admin smooth and good app
Review_TitleAndText: Motorway admin smooth and good app : Motorway part of the experience smooth and efficient. I suspect dealers put in inflated bids above the reserve to ensure they get "dibs" on the car and then assume they can bargain down when viewing it. I feel I should not have agreed to such a drop on the day, despite resolving not to in advance! However, they know you have been through the process and just wish to sell and move on. I am not sure how Motorway can prevent overbidding as a tactic. The people who came were polite and thorough but I did not appreciate not achieving the reserve. The actual process in terms of setting up the car profile for auction and the Motorway admin was fine and I would recommend Motorway for that.

Awful customer service : Awful customer service. Took delivery of my car in January. The car had a broken parcel shelf which was not advised. I called up took 2 hours to get through was told 1 would be sent out. 3 weeks later after all emails were ignored I called again another 1 hour to get through to be told they attempted delivery to my block of flats! I live in a village no flats here at all. Said they will send again. More emails and WhatsApp chats and still no shelf I am past the date of sending car back conveniently also due to customer service being non existent will not be taking out cinch care on car. Myself and son spent ¬£25,000 combined with them and can‚Äôt even get a replacement part. Avoid this company at all costs I am thinking to speak to finance company to see if they can do anything to help just tried calling again and after 50 mins and no answer I have given up. I hate to think what I will do if something else goes wrong with it.

I was then asked to pay 500 pounds for the service but refused because cinch promised me it was done. Finally they agreed to pay it. I was unhappy with the service I received with cinch. So they offered 75 pound good will gesture which was insulting. They raised it to 100 in which I agreed but still wasn‚Äôt happy with. They told me it would take 3-5 days to go into my account but I am still waiting after 6 days. They told me there was an error so now I have to wait another 7-10 days. Would like more compensation if I can get management to contact me

Review_Title: Don't trust the quotation that you are given unless you sell immediately
Review_TitleAndText: Don't trust the quotation that you are given unless you sell immediately : I came to sell my camper van and was given a reserve price of ¬£36,360. However, at this point it needed a service, and I asked the advisor whether to wait and get it serviced or proceed. I was advised to wait and get it serviced. It took me 2 weeks to do this due to availability, I then got it ready for pictures so took me a few more days. I came to upload pictures and was told the price needed re-evaluating because the previous quote was more than 7 days old. When they came back to me they tried to tell me that the price had dropped by ¬£2360 in under 3 weeks to ¬£34,000. When I looked on Autotrader the closest match was ¬£40,000 from a private seller. Needless to say I shall be selling my camper privately now. Absolute joke and an insult to my intelligence.

Review_Title: Selling a car has never been easier
Review_TitleAndText: Selling a car has never been easier  : My experience selling with Cazoo was brilliant from the moment I booked. The booking process was extremely simple and easy to complete, with plenty of choice for days and times of collection. On the day of collection, James called to let me know he was on his way and what time he‚Äôd likely be arriving which was very helpful. Upon arrival James was very polite, and being a young female I felt very comfortable throughout the entire process. My car did get dropped down a category (from excellent to good) when it was inspected, however I do believe this to be fair after James pointed out his reasoning. The new price for my car was quickly relayed and I had the option to continue or not, so I decided to proceed. After this I signed to agree to the sale and the money was in my account instantly. Overall I am very happy with the service and specifically James, who had great customer service throughout!
The process was really simple : The process was really simple. Cazoo even did a safety inspection and replaced the brakes, 2 tyres and a battery. Have been recommending them to others

Review_Title: Sold a car on behalf of my father
Review_TitleAndText: Sold a car on behalf of my father : Sold a car on behalf of my father, explained this and gave his details and location of the vehicle.The car was sold however the buyer reneged when he found out where the car needed to be collected from.The next contact with the Carwow selling team was the worst customer service I think I have ever received. The left hand seemingly not knowing what the right hand is doing. Having sorted out the location issue the car sold again through the next auction for a slightly lower price.The process to upload documents however is easy and straightforward.I was also lucky that the new buyer was excellent and very easy to deal with. This is the second car I have sold through Carwow and this experience will not stop me using them again.

After 15 mins I was called again saying that they are happy to buy my car but at a revised price minus ¬£1300.  The reason?  Computer decided on a new price.  Be aware  they are preying on desperate people who need to sell their cars (end of finance deal etc) in the hope they will buy cheap to maximise their profit.  Of course there is no obligation to accept the offer but the time wasting and the false hopes of a fair deal soured the whole experience.  Never again.

Impeccable service : Impeccable service. From beginning to end I felt safe and secure and valued. Once a car was decided and my car was part exchanged each step was followed with links to help me  tax, insure  , pay etc. Each email explained next steps . The car I chose was pictured as it arrived to Cinch so no surprises. Except when it was delivered to me  any problems had been dealt with including 2 new tires and a windscreen. Daryl who delivered my car, txted me to say he was on his way then again to say this was my 15 minute window and then to say my new car was being washed and would arrive in 10 minutes! How exciting.. On arrival all paper work was checked (having explained to me what was needed  in emails) Then Daryl took me out to me new car and explained everything to me . What an amazing service , so exciting not to have to try and sell my car and then go and look at cars.. My new car comes with a free  90 warranty, 3 free days insurance if needed and a 14 day no quibble money back guarantee. So, if you really want an exciting service leaving you so happy then look at Cinch for a car, take your time they may not have what you need straight away but boy is it worth waiting for. Yes, you could say you would get more selling your car privately but  then you have to advertise and have tire kickers wanting a bargain etc so in the end it makes sense to do the whole thing at the same time new car delivered old car driven away HAPPY DAYS !! Well done Cinch...

Review_Title: WOW ! I sold my car through carWOW
Review_TitleAndText: WOW ! I sold my car through carWOW : WOW ! I now know how they got that name, I got near ¬£1300 more than Motorway offered me. I wasn't expecting much as the advisor recommended I put a reserve on it ¬£1000 less than I would accept, but as you are in control as to whether you sell or not, I gave it a go and was very surprised. My car was mint condition, but to avoid any disappointment point out any faults or damage with photos and you are more likely to get exactly what you were offered. They even arranged collection to deliver car to dealer (my buyer was over 200 miles away), and you even receive payment before your car leaves your drive, it's hard to believe there are no fees. I am one of those people that never leave reviews, but having received such a great service and so much more for my car, that I must. THANK YOU SO MUCH CARWOW !

Review_Title: Maybe do this again, maybe not!
Review_TitleAndText: Maybe do this again, maybe not! : Firstly I must say that buying a car entirely online was a completely new experience for me. I belong to a generation where you would have historically visited the local garages, kicked a few tyres, picked the car you liked, taken it for a test drive and if you were happy would have parted with your hard earned and driven away into the sunset. Now everything appears to have moved on in the car-buying world, I guess it's the same for other retailing too. Now you don't get to see your car 'in person', deciding if you like it or not or even take it for a test drive before paying for it. As I wanted a particular feature on my new (to me) car I made an enquiry with Cazoo to ensure it was included on this particular model and I was assured that it was, so despite being a little nervous about the whole process I went ahead in the knowledge that I had Cazoo's 7-day return policy if I wasn't happy. I parted with my cash and in due course the car arrived. The delivery of the vehicle was probably the best part of the overall experience, Steve was helpful and friendly and ensured that at least his part of the service was handled to his utmost. When it arrived, due to unforeseen circumstances (nothing to do with Cazoo, just one of life's curved balls) I was unable to examine the car in any great detail, other than a cursory check to make sure there were no obvious faults/marks to the outside of the car that I hadn't been previously made aware of and that it had 4 wheels etc. So (electronic) paperwork completed I took delivery of the car, which I must admit, at least externally, looked fantastic. A couple of hours later I decided to go for a test drive. Imagine my disappointment when I started the car that the first thing I noticed that the feature that I checked was on the car (a HUD) and was assured that it was, actually wasn't on this car! I was gutted! I contacted Cazoo on Friday 16/02 and after a (very) long wait on the phone was told by a Customer Care Representative that they weren't personally able to deal with my query but would talk to a supervisor and get back to me. By the following Tuesday I still hadn't heard from them so decided I would contact them again. I was informed that the best method was to 'chat' to them so started the process at number 8 in the queue. 2 hours and 10 minutes later I was down to position 1..............only for the call/chat to disconnect before I had a chance to speak to anyone! So, back on the phone again. This time the wait was just over 30 minutes which after the 2 hours plus waiting to 'chat' seemed like a win! This time the guy that I spoke to was apologetic for my experience to date and promised to get back to me. Further to my previous experience I wasn't sure that this would even happen but everyone deserves a second chance so I put the phone down and waited. A short while later I got my call-back. The guy once again apologised and said that I could either return the car or keep the car with a gesture of goodwill. At this point, taking external factors into account, again nothing to do with Cazoo, I decided to keep the car as it was. The "goodwill" was sent to me in due course and that pretty much concludes my experience which overall was a mixed bag. The good was really excellent and the bad was really not so good! Finally, I'm not too sure I would go through this way of buying a car again, or at least would go through the car with a toothcomb (which under other circumstances I would probably have done) when it was delivered. On the positive I think (other than the missing HUD option) the car was as described, certainly in relation to marks/scratches/scuffs etc on the outside but would have liked to know that there were other things missing such as car mats (cost me ¬£150 to get luxury mats from my jaguar dealer), the covers for the Isofix fixings in the back seat (cost me ¬£64) and an owners manual (¬£80). So, thank you to Steve (delivery) and Elliot (customer services), you were the highlight of my online car-buying experience
Easy process : Fast and easy service. Great communication throughout the process

Faulty vehicle! : I purchased a nissan qashqai of which I collect Friday 16th of February. Upon the collection of my vehicle the outside was clean however the inside was not, the boot was covered in dog hair, the driver/ front passenger footwells were covered in mud, dirt and the odometer ddashboard was extremely dirty to which I assumed would just require a wipe down however the smears/dirt are on the others otherside of the plastic and will require this to be removed professionally so it can be cleaned properly and not cause a distraction while driving. The rest of the car will also require a professional valet. On Monday 19th the 3rd time I had drove the car since collection the battery had died and I had to be jump started. The RAC attended the vehicle and reported a new battery was required and he could fit this however I would need to pay for it! I refuse as i had only had the vehicle 3 days! I contacted yourselves by phone after 50 mins on hold I spoke to a member of the customer service team and was authorised to take the vehicle to kwirk fit for the new battery and a vehicle inspection on your account. The earliest appointment I could get with my local kwirk fit was Wednesday 830am. Once I dropped the vehicle of I was advised I will be contacted by phone with their findings, that afternoon I received the phone call that it was not the battery but it was the alternator and they had tried to contact yourselves to obtain authorisation to repair this however could not get through. I then again contacted yourselves after another 45 min on hold I was told they had to speak to kwirk fit and not me! I then phoned kwirk fit and advised them this and was told he will do best to get through however due to how busy they were couldn't stay on hold. After another hour I received the car to confirm this had been authorised and part had been ordered however the part will not arrive until Friday 23rd!. Aa I am writing this Saturday i am still without a car in the 8 days of having this vehicle I've only been able to use it for 3!.
Wonderful experience : Wonderful experience. Delivery was excellent and very helpful.

Stay clear of cinch!!  : Ordered my car online and decided to add the extra CinchShield at an extra cost of ¬£200 - including ceramic coating and seats scotchgarded. had to wait nearly 3 weeks for delivery so figured that the car should be spotless and nice and shiny when it arrived. How wrong was I, car arrived and the condition was terrible, scratched paintwork, door shuts looked like the previous owner had sand paper shoes, interior was absolutely disgusting and was definitely not cleaned since the previous owner, mud on the seats cigarette ash all over the dash, all the small spaces and cup holders were covered in spilled drinks. Rear heater vents were broken and hanging out! Cinch we‚Äôre willing to put these right but in my time at my costs (they would refund me on proof of receipt)! Emails were going backwards and forwards again in my time when I should have been enjoying the experience of my new car!

Easy process : It was easy to see what vehicle you wanted and the process was explained of how to purchase the car and how to part exchange your own vehicle in a simple way.... The communication was excellent throughout the experience via email and phone calls as was booking the delivery timeslot. The only downside was that they drive the car to you and drive your part ex away which does not get mentioned.. I was under the impression that it would come on a small transporter , therefore not putting extra mileage or wear and tear on the vehicle you are buying.

Review_Title: Spent over ¬£1,000 on Repairs, "Not covered under warranty"
Review_TitleAndText: Spent over ¬£1,000 on Repairs, "Not covered under warranty" : I bought a Mercedes GLA from Cazoo last year, with this being a premium car I opted to take out the warranty cazoo provided to give me peace of mind. Before having the car a full year the car has broken down with a gearbox failure and exhaust issues. In total the repairs cost over ¬£1.2k and when I called the warranty company they weren't interested and every answer was "sorry we don't cover that". I will not be purchasing a car from Cazoo again and I advise anyone that does not to purchase the fake warranty you have to pay extra for. They are quick to take the money out of your account every month but when you actually require the service they are not interested. Cazoo are selling broken cars with a warranty that does not actually cover you for repairs. Disgraceful.

Disappointing : I wanted to sell my car through carwow as I had heard good things and read good reviews. It was a simple process to set up, and easy to do it all online with a phone call from them to check everything. So far so good (and why this is 2 stars). Then it went south quickly. They suggested a price online, but then on the phone recommended a lower price as a "reserve". I said no, but then they said they won't list it at the original valuation price they themselves had indicated. Fine - car went for auction and got the reserve (probably a way to ensure their "success rate" and drag you in with a higher quote so you use them). The dealer they matched me with couldn't come for a week, so I turned down other potential buyers to be true to my CarWow promise. Then, when the dealer finally found the time to come they found something, undisclosed wrong with the car (they gave some vague excuse of a part being replaced wrongly - complete nonsense, and not a good line to take with someone who knows their car) and dropped the bid to...wait for it...40% of the reserve. I'm back to square 1 and a very very unhappy customer. I would advise anyone looking to sell their car to really understand what CarWow offers, how they match you with dealers and how they do their quotes and reserve. If you're OK with all that then great. I am not and will not use them again.

A disappointing service from Cinch : This has been an incredibly painful and stressful process, first off all when buying the car the online delivery offered was a Tuesday when actually going through with the purchase the date then changed to Friday, when I contacted Cinch and asked if there was anything they could do to get the vehicle sooner as first advertised I was told that it was out of there hands and nothing they could do as they didn‚Äôt have many drivers, I even offered to collect the car to make it quicker which they also refused to allow. I have therefore had to make other arrangements for the car to be delivered on another day which was not of convenience but was set up anyway, one day before that was supposed to be delivered they had emailed to say that it was now coming at a different time to planned when I made them aware I would be unable to accommodate this time decided to ignore me and still try and deliver the car when I contacted them about this they said that I would now have to wait a further 4 days for there error even though I was left without any vehicle due to arrangements that had been made, when I contacted them again no helpful solution was made and even tho it was there error in changing the agreement still refused to deliver the car any sooner. The overall service and customer service received was incredibly poor and not what you would expect from a company off this size. Overall the car delivered tho is fantastic and although a little dent that I was not made about, it does drive well and I got the vehicle for a fair price. I would not use this company to purchase a car again.

Review_Title: Don't believe what you see on screen
Review_TitleAndText: Don't believe what you see on screen : Carwow messages me saying the Rav4 is in stock in Oxford. I messaged the dealer early this morning asking if it is AWD? 6hrs later no reply, so I call the dealer direct. "Last one sold" was the response. I expected this as I had same replies with a Hyundai i10 order for my wife. We now have a new VW E-UP in the garage as the dealer had it in the showroom. For my replacement, there are no Rav4's available until May 24. Same as a Bristol dealer advised yesterday...and May is very optimistic! Could be June or July as it is built in Japan. My gripe is that CarWow says the dealer has a new unregistered Rav4 Excel in Decuma Grey in stock. I have screen shot to show that I am not barking mad. I have submitted the reference for Carwow to investigate. Hardly any of these dealers have any stock in the UK, and now spent several days tracking availability. Loads of 21 & 22 plates, but no 24's or even pre-reg 73's. I am unsubscribing from this site as you cannot believe anything.

On the day the buyer came to collect the car it transpired Carwow haven't reported that the car would need new back tyres which I mentioned to them both in initial write up and follow up phone call. Review_Title: I bought a car from cinch in October 23‚Ä¶
Review_TitleAndText: I bought a car from cinch in October 23‚Ä¶ : I bought a car from cinch in October 23 for ¬£8000. Not long after, the oil and service light came on. I took it to a garage and they filled up the oil which was completely empty as was the coolant fluid. Not knowing much about cars I didn‚Äôt think much of it, until about a month later when the oil light came back on. The oil was completely empty again. Long story short it took Cinch a month to get it booked into a garage, then the garage didn‚Äôt do the right tests, so another 2 weeks to get it booked in again. It‚Äôs now in the garage again but they can‚Äôt run the tests needed without Cinch‚Äôs permission but Cinch are not answering the garages request to test. Day 2 in the garage and counting and me without a car. The garage has categorically said that they have sold me a car that is not fit for purpose and there is no way I could have created this problem with the 1500miles I have travelled in it. I spoke to someone at Cinch today, after 20mins on hold, who has opened up a request for a return and refund on the car, but could not guarantee I would get a refund. I just want my money back, and to be reimbursed for lost work days and taxis. I do not need this hassle in my life. Ultimately they have broken their side of the deal by selling me a broken car. I would never had spent ¬£8000 on a car that needs a new engine. I will wait to see Cinch‚Äôs next move before I leave another review. I hope it can be higher than 1 star. I also hope that they deal with it quickly, as I first flagged up this issue nearly 2 months ago and I still have a broken car that I paid ¬£8000 for. I will get lawyers involved if need be.

Upsetting Experience and sub-standard service : It started so well - purchase and pick up fine. Agreed to pay for the extended warranty (4 years) as we were sold peace of mind whereby any issues the car would be collected and repaired while a courtesy car was provided. After only 3 days a fault developed whereby the drivers door would not open but all the others would. After the usual delays in finally getting to speak to someone they offered to carry out repairs, however this would have taken them several days to get quotes and organise and they wouldn't organise a courtesy car for us in the meantime either. As the car was unsafe to drive, in the event of an accident you would not be able to rescue someone from the drivers side we decided to return the car, which as it is unsafe to drive cannot be collected for another week. In the meantime we have no car, money is not refunded until 3-5 days after returning and also advised we shouldn't apply for finance until the agreement is ended which is 10 days after the car is returned. All the while we now have to pay for taxi's, insurance and road tax plus the ¬£75 of fuel that we will now not get the benefit off. Such a shame as lovely cat, however the whole experience is so disappointing and upsetting. Hope no one else has to experience this

Second great experience  : This was my second experience buying a car from Cazoo. First time was at Exeter which has sadly now gone, but this time was at Bristol. I bought a Seat Leon two years ago and absolutely loved the car. I had no problems in those two years and fancied an upgrade. I ordered a Seat Ateca to Bristol and part exchanged my Leon (which Cazoo were pretty generous with the valuation of). I was greeted with a friendly face and was offered free tea or coffee which was very nice. My Leon was checked over and accepted, and my new Ateca was unveiled to me. It was in beautiful condition just as the photos showed on the website. I was taken through all the new bits of tech etc. and the basics of driving an automatic gearbox. I had a lovely drive home to Cornwall where I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll love my new car until the next one. Special mention to Ohi who was amazing on the day and did everything and more to help me out.

satisfied customers : you made it all effortless and enjoyable buying and selling a car which is not always the case.

Absolute scam. : What a con don't waste your time, put my car to auction and the the highest offer came back at exactly to the pound the same as their reserve price ( which was already low ) and then they expect you to believe that the dealers don't know the reserve, absolute barefaced lie, also told by staff pre auction that I would receive a phone call to set a reserve when it didn't happen I rang back and they said that was mis information and not what they do, save yourself a lot of time and get more money for your cars do not use these con artists.

Review_Title: Worst company I've ever dealt with - and no car to show for it
Review_TitleAndText: Worst company I've ever dealt with - and no car to show for it : AVOID AVOID AVOID. A month down the line and still no car! We ordered a car at the end of Feb, which wasn't exactly smooth as the website glitched and told us the car had been sold at the last stage twice - which resulted in multiple finance applications and 3 orders on the Cinch account. Eventually got that sorted and we asked if this mess would cause a delay to the order. Told on the phone it shouldn't and that we should be able to get it by 8th March or there abouts, website said 12th. However, it was then arranged for delivery on 18th. 18th rolls around, we're excited to get the car, and then we got a call to say there had been a delay and that it would be delivered on 23rd March. Still not sure why there was a delay. Then  yesterday we got a call saying there was a delay (again! Though the advisor wasn't aware this wasn't the first time) and that the delivery should still get to us on 23rd but much later in the day. Today comes, we don't get the call back as promised so we chase up - they said they'd get back to us within the hour but we allowed a few. No call back, so we chased again - and in this call it has been pushed back until 26th! Meanwhile we're paying insurance on a car we don't have, we've wasted 2 days just waiting for a car that then doesn't come, and the whole experience has left a rather bitter taste. We'd feel a lot better about the situation if Cinch were more proactive in communicating problems and were clearer in telling us what the issue actually is. Strongly considering cancelling the order since this car seems to be a unicorn, but we're holding off while we find a suitable alternative.  If they deliver in the meantime, great, but it had better arrive exactly as described, and they had better give us the price quoted for our part exchange. Would have appreciated some kind of goodwill gesture by now, but nothing has been offered to remedy the significant inconvenience. If we could go back in time, we would avoid Cinch completely, so I'm posting this review to hopefully spare others from a similar experience.

Review_TitleAndText: Make buying a car really easy : Make buying a car really easy

Lovely staff : Helen and Rob dropped my car off and were a joy to meet. They were both knowledgable about the process and put me at ease about buying a car online. They let me know what to expect and were very helpful, friendly and warm. Both a huge credit to Cinch! üòä

Cinch cars is super reliable : Cinch cars is super reliable, and their cars are more beautiful when you finally take delivery. Thier customer service is second to none so I want to give them a seven star rating. Cinch cars is a premium brand üëå all day.. cheers üçª to Cinch cars..

Definitely not ‚Äòcars without the faff‚Äô! : Had an outstandingly awful experience with Cinch. It started with the car not arriving on the agreed delivery day. I was assured that Customer Services would call me later that day, but no-one did. After a number of calls, the car arrived 4 days later (13 days after placing the order). When it arrived, it had five more scratches/marks than highlighted on their imperfections list, and it was filthy inside - muddy, dog hairs, and smelt of wet dog. Having raised these with the delivery man, he advised to call Cinch to report the issues. Cinch accepted the car fell short of standards and advised that I‚Äôd need to get costs for the bodywork repairs, and a cost for a valet. Whilst getting costs, I was informed that the front tyres were illegal and the back tyres weren‚Äôt far off. When I reported this back to Cinch and forwarded the quotes, they said I‚Äôd need to get more quotes, and get a tyre health report. The tyre report said one needed changing immediately and three had an advisory to change. Cinch agreed to pay for one tyre to be replaced, and half of the valet cost. They wouldn‚Äôt pay for the body work costs until they had more quotes. After much running around, I was sick of the whole experience so I sent the car back. The whole process with Cinch was shockingly terrible and I wouldn‚Äôt go near them again. Buying a car this way was a first for me - I thought the process would be simple and professional - but it was appalling. It cost me hours of my time - on the phone, emailing, and obtaining quotes. Cinch are clearly sending out sub-standard cars. My advice is to proceed with caution and don‚Äôt expect the process, or the car, to be as smooth as their marketing.
KeyPhrases: tyre report said one needed changing immediately

Review_Title: Okay but dealers still try lowball you
Review_TitleAndText: Okay but dealers still try lowball you  : Process is fairly straight forward albeit a lot of hoops to jump through. However all of the technical process is undone by unscrupulous dealers who try and low ball you with BS about the car and how everything is broken. Delivery was late : Delivery was late, communication could have been better but they do answer emails. Worst customer service experience ever. : I bought a Jeep Renegade from Cinch, the buying process was very good. I booked delivery, and booked a days holiday for this. On the day, I had a phone call stating that the vehicle had been damaged during transit and the wheel trim was hanging off, so will need to be takien back to the garage. I then asked if the car had been in an accident whilst travelling. I was told by support "definitely not, we wouldn't lie to you about that", she then sent me a picture, which showed a dent and scratches and I said this car has definitely been in an accident, they continued to deny this. I then asked if they were going to reduce the price of the car, as now damaged and be compensated for taking a day's holiday. They said "we don't do that, Cinch do not provide compensation". After many back and forths they admitted it had been in a collision, but still would not reduce the price, as the damage was 'cosemetic' and the value of the car would not be reduced. I stated that this is untrue, if I took the car to their sister company 'webuyanycar' I am certain the valuation would be different pre and post accident. They did not care about my experience or the cost incurred by me. I requested a refund for the car which they provided.

It was a good experience : It was a good experience. I was a bit afraid when I started the communication with them. But every thing went smoothly and within a week the car was at my doorstep. Amazing job.

Review_Title: Fantastic service and would use again‚Ä¶
Review_TitleAndText: Fantastic service and would use again‚Ä¶ : The whole process from start to finish was smooth sailing. Couldn‚Äôt recommend Cinch enough. They support you from the word go. I won‚Äôt lie I was really dubious about paying for a car and not seeing or not test driving it first. But you get 14 days cooling off and touch wood, I have nothing to complain about. The car was clean and in great condition, the delivery driver called when they said he would, was very friendly and honest and arrived bang on time.

Where do I start : Where do I start?  The car delivery was delayed because the battery was flat.  When it arrived it was filthy inside with bits of trim missing.  There was even rubbish from the previous keeper in the door pockets.  I had to spend a whole day cleaning it.  Wiper blades needed replacing.  Coolant level was low.  There is an odd rumbling noise coming from the car that needs investigating.  The trim at the base of the windscreen was unattached and letting in water.  The advert said that the car had been serviced in February but no evidence in the service history - in fact the service history suggests it is 2 years overdue.  Everything suggests that the car did not have any sort of pre-delivery inspection.  Emailed a complaint on 12 March 2024 but not received an acknowledgement or response.  Chased up with another email on Monday 18 March 2024 but still no response.  Just been in a call queue for 33 minutes only to get cut off.  I really like the car but need to sort these issues out but can't get hold of anyone to help.  What do I do?

Then received an email confirming the car was going into the next sale, for it then to revert back to ‚Äòchecking your profile‚Äô the next day.  Also, as I had originally quoted under my private registration, I get emails with that, but the original registration is on my profile? The car was also listed under my private registration despite me confirming the old plates had been on for weeks.  Confusing for everyone ‚Äì surely, they can change the registration quite easily to be uniform across email/web/app? I called to enquire at 12pm why it had moved back a step and was assured it would be in that night‚Äôs auction at 7pm which thankfully it was.
