Review_Title: My partner bought a car from here in‚Ä¶
Review_TitleAndText: My partner bought a car from here in‚Ä¶ : My partner bought a car from here in October 2023 and since the day we got it there has been nothing but problems. When the car was delivered to us there was a dent and scratch on the back passenger door that they said they would fix for them to send someone out and it was to severe for it to get fixed on the side of the road. I called them to let know that it was to go into a body shop and there reply was that he was to find a body shop to do the work which was hard to do when u work 6days a week. I eventually got a quote and they said I was too much and wanted a more detailed estimate. Then after only having the car a couple of weeks the battery and the clutch switch went and we had to pay for a knew 1 a few weeks before Christmas. Then it broke down a few weeks after that and was sitting out side our house for weeks before they got it lifted and taken to a specialist garage and has been there since January we have repeatedly told them we don‚Äôt want the car back as it‚Äôs just been problem after problem with it and we have been calling them at least twice a week to be told someone will call us back and it never happens. Now it‚Äôs to come out of the specialist garage and go into a body shop to get the scratch and dent fixed.We have had to get a deposit together to get another car as we need it for work because we where to if we didn‚Äôt get a car soon we will loss our job and the are reluctant to give us our money back after repeatedly telling them we are not accepting the car back.

Review_Title: Easy way to buy a used car
Review_TitleAndText: Easy way to buy a used car : I was initially very reluctant to buy something as important and expensive as a new (used) car online. It seemed a big risk to lay out a large sum of money without seeing it in the flesh, as it were. However to find the car I wanted would have led to some long journeys some of which may well have been unproductive, so I decided to take the plunge and try online.

Very unhappy customer : I think this company needs to uphold it's policy and check their cars before selling them. From day one the engine management light was on and off. I put it down to a sensor issue as I assumed the car had been stationary for a while and it seemed to drive ok. After this, I noticed a juddering with the brakes (I was used to driving an old Honda so, at the beginning, it felt smooth), this is when the engine light stayed on and I phoned for help. It was promptly booked into my local Mercedes garage. They found all brake pads and discs needed attention, a ball joint had gone (MOT failure) and an issue with the nitrous oxide sensor. Basically I was left with no car for 6 days. No courtesy car and no communication over what was happening. I strongly advise not to use the text or WhatsApp option to communicate as it can take a couple of days to get a response. Long story short, I phoned Cinch today and asked for the car to be taken back and the credit company to be dealt with and money taken so far, reimbursed. We will see if I get my money back in full. I can not recommend this company and will never buy a car from them again. This was all in 3 weeks. I forgot to add that I received a speeding ticket for the delivery driver which has hopefully been resolved.

Highly recommended : Excellent service from the moment I decided to purchase a car. I was kept up-to-date every step of the way and given sound advice on what to do and when. Extremely pleased with the car when it was delivered. I would certainly recommend Cinch

Extremely disappointed customer - AVOID : Purchased a car via Cinch, initially the delivery date, which was shown online as Tuesday 12th March, as i proceeded and paid the deposit etc the delivery date changed to 19th March, which was disappointing, i tried to get this changed to an earlier date but was advised this was not an option. I thought ok I‚Äôll just wait after all what‚Äôs a few days more.

Review_Title: What a horrendous experience we had‚Ä¶
Review_TitleAndText: What a horrendous experience we had‚Ä¶ : What a horrendous experience we had with Cinch. Purchased a Citreon C3 car for my mother-in-law. Car arrived on time, but when we drove the car to get fuel, approx 1/4 mile away, on the way back home a red light on the dashboard and warning sign on the screen saying "engine fault, get repaired" came on. I immedately called Cinch and spoke to a customer service agent, after holding on for 50 mins. He said he would get the AA to come to look at the car. He asked me to call them to arrange. I called the AA who said they would not come to see the car as it was still driveable. I called Cinch back, and got the same customer service agent, who told me they would get it booked in to a local dealer for repair, and that he would look after this to make sure we ere satisfied. Said he would call me back before 5pm that day. "Nothing happened". I emailed Cinch the next day, and a different customer service agent said they were trying to book it in to the local dealer. I received another email later that day saying the car was booked in for repair with the dealer 3 weeks later. I emailed back to say that if this was the case I would need a replacement car, as we had traded my mother-in-law car in with Cinch, which they had taken away, and also that the timescale would be outside the 14 day money back guarantee, and I would require this guarantee to start when the car was repaired and road worthy. The next day I received a further email, from another different customer service agent, saying they cannot extend the 14 day money back guarantee, and that the best they can do was supply a loan car for a maximum of 7 days, and added let her know when I would like the loan car. Absolutely rediculous considering they supply goods not fit for purpose. after emails going back and forward regarding wanting our money back, I managed to contact, by phone, Cinch returns department, and spoke to a manager called Alex. He was the only person I got in Cinch who was sympathetic and talked sense. He told me the process they would start, which included the uplift of the faulty car, and the return of the money paid. This has all been duly done, but I have submitted a complaint with Cinch regarding all of this, and also a claim for the ¬£65 of fuel put in the car, and also the ¬£80 extra on my mother-in-law premium she paid for her car insurance due to changing her car. Cinch email said they will get back to me within 8 weeks, and I am still waiting on a response to this complaint. BEWARE THIS COMPANY. The driver who uplifted the car said that was the 4th car that week he had uplifted due to faults showing in their cars just after delivery.

Review_Title: Don‚Äôt buy a car from Cinch!
Review_TitleAndText: Don‚Äôt buy a car from Cinch!  : Not one for writing reviews but our experience with cinch has been one of the most slow and painful processes. We got our car, the jaguar ipace, on 06/02/24 and on 08/02/24 the heating completely stopped. We emailed them and also called their customer care helpline to book the car in for repair. After hours of being on a call and delayed responses from them, they managed to get us a repair date on the 1/3/24 which was outside the 14 day return period. The car was picked up on 1/3/24 and they provide us with a dorsal replacement which means that we have to pay for our electric cars down payment plus fuel for the replacement car. We have tried calling them and writing to them with limited to no response. They would not respond to emails until I wrote to them at least 6 - 7 times and the response I received was ‚Äúthe car has been received at our workshop‚Äù. My husband has been on calls with them ever since and tried to get an update on the status but the customer support team are not able to provide an update on the vehicle or even get through to their own repair team. Its been over 16 days since they have had the vehicle and we‚Äôve not received any updates or responses to further emails. If we would have had an idea about how bad the service was, we could have returned the vehicle to them and gone with a better dealer.

The issue is then having to deal with the proposed purchaser who is out to reduce the amount bid as far as possible, to the extent of overplaying any ‚Äòissues‚Äô found. You can see the extent of that when you see the car being sold on at an inflated price a week later.

A happy customer  : Don't usually leave reviews but I thought I would this time in order to say how easy it was using Cinch. As someone who has bought numerous cars over the years I was a little unsure about buying one online having not seen or driven it. I had nothing to worry about, the car was exactly as described. I was given a good part exchange price which also helped. The day of delivery went smoothly with the delivery driver Paul being a pleasure to deal with unlike a number of car salesmen I've dealt with over the years. It's a new concept buying cars online, but certainly something I would do in the future. Overall I'm very happy with the process and the company came across as very professional at every stage.

Review_Title: Ordered a car, never delivered, still waiting for refund
Review_TitleAndText: Ordered a car, never delivered, still waiting for refund : Ordered a car, paid in full and delivery scheduled for following week.  On day of delivery (car was due in the morning) we got a call around 11am to say there was a problem with a brake sensor and the car was being taken back to the depot.  The following afternoon we called to try and find out what was happening as no-one had called back.  Were told it needed booking in and once that was done we would then get a new scheduled date for delivery.  No clue as to how long it would take.  No further update the following day so we cancelled the order.  We were told that payment would take up to 2 days.  When these two days were up, no payment received so I called again.  I was then told that the finance people had gone home for the weekend, and I shouldn't have been told two days as three days was the minimum.  Still no money received.  Bunch of crooks.

Hassle free, recommended!  : Hassle free, good communication, lovely chap who delivered the car called Tony. Car itself as described and in very decent condition, Cinch threw in four new tyres as an added bonus. Recommended!

Review_Title: Cinch is a world class service - end to end.
Review_TitleAndText: Cinch is a world class service - end to end. : I think Cinch is probably the best service I've used in a very long time.  Even better than AO who I think are great.  I needed a new car after my company came to an end and didn't really have much time to make a decision. I went to some garage but there simply wasn't enough choices and options. I came across a number of sites which I tried and decided Cinch was the best.  I think overall it took me about 3 days elapsed to find the car I wanted, speak to Cinch on questions I had (I reckon 2 hours) and all answered to my satisfaction and then the process (including credit checks and financing) was done very quickly and I had my date booked for delivery before I could blink. I'm now driving my new car!

Overall really positive : Overall really positive, only glitch was the timing as I was informed my car would go into auction on a Friday, however, that never happened and by the time I got a call back it was too late to enter into a Saturday auction so it pushed out my onward car purchase. Other than that it was flawless :-)

Review_Title: Absolutely devastated by the poor service
Review_TitleAndText: Absolutely devastated by the poor service  : I never normally write reviews but I'm not getting anywhere with Cazoo customer service. Spend over ¬£10k on a new car 3 months ago from Chertsey and had a persistent sound which I tried to get them to do something about under their 3 month 'warranty'. 2 months into the warranty I contacted them and after being told to get an independent report (at my cost).. which I did, they FINALLY agreed to look at the car. The first garage they sent me to (1.5 hours away from my house) turned me away and said they do not even do work for cazoo. Great start. Then after weeks of chasing they put it into a local Halfords. And after Halfords gave them the report of work it needed doing (serious MOT failure work NOT minor wear and tear issues) cazoo said no as I'm out of the warranty period. Despite the fact I first reported this mid way thought the warranty period. Absolute crooks and I'll never buy another vehicle from them again. I'm writing this to warn others, I am NOT writing it to get on Cazoo's customer service radar as they do not care less.

Review_Title: EDIT: Wish I had listened to the negative reviews
Review_TitleAndText: EDIT: Wish I had listened to the negative reviews : Called on the day of delivery, half an hour into the delivery time slot to be told that they found a fault with the car this morning and it will not be delivered today. No thought to the fact that I'd taken the day off work and took my hire card back the previous day. They're now saying I will be "updated" on Monday but they can not tell me when the car will be delivered. Doing these so-called "final checks" on the morning of delivery, and finding a major fault, all seems a bit suspect to me. Unfortunately, it doesn't look like I'm the first person this has happened to and I'm sure I won't be the last. Wish I had listened to the negative reviews, absolutely shocking customer service.

Review_TitleAndText: ¬£20000 car I bought and full of‚Ä¶ : ¬£20000 car I bought and full of scratches and damages that wasn't mentioned at the time of buying, complained by email but been ignored. I think I made a big mistake by buying online.

Legendary level service : If you're in need of a car repair specialist who's as reliable as a Roland and as skilled as a Zer0, look no further than Olie from Cinch. From the moment I handed over my vehicle, Olie displayed the precision of a sharpshooter identifying the issue and seems to be a savant when it comes to vehicles. Leaving my car running like a well-oiled Hyperion machine. Not only did Olie fix my vehicle with the finesse of a Siren, but he also provided exceptional customer service, communicating every step of the repair process. It was evident that Olie takes pride in their work, ensuring that each repair was completed with the attention to detail with none of the Claptrap I was concerned about!

Great car, utterly terrible collection  : I asked to collect my car at 2pm, on the day of collection I get a call at 7am saying the delivery driver is waiting for me. I wait until 8am when the Cinch phone lines open to confirm that this is actually them and not some sort of scam. They tell me that yes it's the delivery driver. So I have to now take my morning off of work (unpaid) to collect this car. I turn up to collect the car, sign a document and give the delivery driver my keys, I ask to get a few bits out of my car I have left over(planned to clean it before I went to collect it at 2pm but did not get a chance due to having to pick it up at 8am) as soon as I collect my things and turn around the delivery driver is already in my car and shot off, no walk around my car, didn't stick around to answer any questions, nothing, just zoomed off and that was that. Cinch said that the delivery driver would "walk you through your car", nope that didn't happen. No cinchcard either when it said that would be left, dirty inside and out (I can understand it being dirty on the outside since it had been driven here ofcourse)

Review_Title: If I could give 0 stars I would
Review_TitleAndText: If I could give 0 stars I would : If I could give 0 stars I would! Received our car 2 weeks late and reeking of dog! Within a week the car started squealing so took it to a garage to be told all 4 brake pads would need replacing and one tyre at the end of its life. This would cost us ¬£800 + which is an absolute joke for a car that we had only just got. Informed Cinch who then wanted us to take the car to Halfords for a check which we did and now we are being ignored!!!! 4 days since contacting them with the Halfords report and still waiting to hear back. No point calling them unless you have an hour to spend on hold and frankly nothing gets resolved when they do answer. Absolute shambles from the start and so disappointing! Would appreciate someone get in touch asap!

I was told I would be updated. Well this is where my issue is the so called "customer service " was absolutely appalling I gave it two days to be updated as I thought someone would let me know but nope I had to phone and was on hold for 50 minutes to be told there was no update and someone phone me the next day, and surprisingly I didn't get a call or email so again 2 days later I phoned again being on hold for 45 minutes to be told again there was no update and that I would be called the following day. So when nobody had called by 2pm the following day I called again on hold again for 45 minutes now this time I was offered a hire car for the duration of time it took to get my car which I was told would be the following week.. well I had my hire car for almost 2 weeks and in that time nobody contacted me it was always me having to phone to get updated and each time being on hold for 45 minutes and even doing the WhatsApp chat I waited a day for a reply so that wasn't much better!

Review_Title: I am very unhappy with the service
Review_TitleAndText: I am very unhappy with the service : I am very unhappy with the service.  Firstly, I was pressured to leave a trustpilot review before even leaving with the car. I rated it 4 and the individual showing me around took my phone out of the car "to put registration details" and then changed my rating to a 5 without my knowledge. Then as soon as I drove the car there was a tyre pressure warning, which is shocking seeing as the car is supposed to be safety checked. I logged a report straight away, but 4 days later still not response from cazoo. By then my tyre was completely flat and so I couldn't make use of the 7 day trial. I was then advised on a Sunday to go to kwikfit to get the tyre changed. This kwikfit tried to call the cazoo payment authorising line but this was not open (and I was not informed this by customer service), I therefore had to pay ¬£172 out of my own pocket for a tyre due to no fault of my own. I then contacted customer service for a reimbursement to which they said they can only give me ¬£106 as they would only authorise a budget tire. However,  this was due to no fault of my own so it doesn't make sense! I asked for a full reimbursement but have still not been responded to. The 7 day trial has not really been 7 days, and I've had work so not managed to go and change another tyre that also needs changing according  to the kwikfit report and my 7 days is approaching tomorrow. I have not been treated well by cazoo, they don't seem to care about reported issues with the car. The reported issue meant I cannot even drive the car in my 7 day trial, and I've had to pay money out of my own pocker, but it just hasn't been taken seriously. This has been my worst car buying experience and I would not recommend.
Great service : Great service, fantastic deal, and Edison was very friendly and informative. Looking forward to driving the new car!

Review_Title: Not without a hitch but definitely good result
Review_TitleAndText: Not without a hitch but definitely good result : The process requires more effort than some alternative providers of this service but is worth it. Once the initial steps have been taken, things are straightforward and quick. Of course, sale is subject to a detailed inspection when the dealership collects the car and that led to a quite significant reduction in the price I had been offered (the sunblind had stopped working on the very day the car was collected and I was told it could be expensive to fix). However, I was still satisfied with the money I got, which was at the higher end of what I had expected, and it hit my bank account within 15 minutes of the confirmation of sale by the dealership. Would I recommend Motorway? I would. Definitely.

Not a great experience  : I had uploaded all my car photos then added information to the portal. I then had an email saying car couldn‚Äôt be added as it had a service notification showing. Then I left it, had email saying am I still selling, I explained I was told I can‚Äôt, then had advisor call me who said he‚Äôd list it. Listed with faults which I was honest about price dropped from ¬£3,500 to ¬£2,500. Went to auction had an offer of 2,100. Took the offer. Dealer arranged visit- turned up then said he‚Äôd travelled a long way to get there, that there were loads of issues- which id already listed on the auction listing and pointed out that‚Äôs why it was cheaper than guide price already ( things like scratches and cracked bumper) he then told me he would only pay ¬£1,000. I had emailed motorway beforehand asking what would happen when dealer turned up and no one ever replied.

They told me they had all my original details including my photographs and would relist it and I would receive an email at 330pm the following day. When no email arrived, I rang up and enquired. They told me that they couldn't relist it as they didn't have the original photographs and the "Closing Team" had all gone home. I then went and took all the required photos once again and thought I may as well relist it as a new sale. This morning I rang to have it relisted with the new photos only to be told that's not possible as it was still on file from previously, I'd have to use the original profile. After trying to explain about the photos, I was put through to the "Closing Team". They informed me that it couldn't be relisted for another 3 weeks or, I could put it back on now as a "buy it now" option with a fixed price of almost ¬£2k below the original offer.

I have the peace of mind of the 14 day return & the Cinch warranty if anything goes wrong. Not much different from driving away from a dealership, except much quicker & smoother. Cinch for me from now on, for new purchases.

I took the car to MB garage in Cardiff where they were not able to fix it and sent detailed analysis to cinch. Since then everytime I am trying to get in touch with Cinch for this issue, they say car doesn't have a wifi and that is why you cant connect. My issue was related to multimedia connectivity via cable and every time customer support representative is redirecting it to wifi issue . This is ridiculous. Problem with them is not a single person handling a customer. Even though I brought original issue to their attention many time, they still dont want to understand my issue.

So I proceeded to the selling process getting as far as  trying to provide photos.  However, the app blanked out my phone camera and I could not work around this obstacle.  Your office suggested sending me an email to which I should reply with attached photos which I did.  However, your email scrambled the data and you were not able to access the photos.  Thinking this might because I attached too many at once, I tried various permutations eventually trying to attach just one photo - again scrambled.  Your staff were very polite but obviously unable to deal with the technical malfunction; I'm sorry, after trying for 2 days I've had enough!

Review_TitleAndText: The promise of cinch returning your‚Ä¶ : UPDATED REVIEW: You keep emailing me to update my review and can see from your comment below that I was happy with the resolution, I wasn‚Äôt, you insulted me with an offer of ¬£80 compensation to which you then reviewed and increased to ¬£125, for the weeks of not being able to use the car that I purchased from you, the insult of offering a small 3 door car when I purchased an SUV, telling me you wanted to get me back on the road and not a like for like vehicle, you never had me on the road in the first place, hours of phone calls, lie after lie telling me you will call me back. On the drive home the tyre warning light kept turning on and a few days later the oil pressure warning light illuminated. After countless calls, hours out of work, and waiting 2 days for a hire car I was informed the car only required an oil pressure sensor changing and this took 3 weeks. Two days after getting the car back the same issue occurred and with many arguments between cazoo trying to persuade the mechanic it was just the battery, the wet belt was changed along with a number of other related issues. This was ¬£700 of work and a customer should never have to plead for basic needs. Not to mention I had received no emails of updates throughout this whole process and was even given 4 hours to drop a courtesy car off and drive 69 miles to pick my car up otherwise I was without a car again. I could not recommend Cazoo to anyone on the premises that an issue arises. 3 months of full cover only to have my car 1 month of it and no extension was provided on this faulty car sold to me. Review_Title: Simple and fast process to sell car
Review_TitleAndText: Simple and fast process to sell car : Simple and fast process to sell car.  You need to hold firm against price nibbles at every step of the journey. My advice is be 100% honest and upfront on the condition of the car and then hold firm on the committed price.

Review_TitleAndText: Horrendous start, faith restored by 2 amazing women! : Ok‚Ä¶booked half a day off work for home delivery between 1pm-6pm. Got to 5.30pm and heard nothing. Review_Title: Cinch sold us an unsafe car
Review_TitleAndText: Cinch sold us an unsafe car : We bought a Renault Megane from Cinch. On the second day the engine light came on. I had to drive an hour to the nearest dealership that had an available appointment within the two week period, The dealership informed us that the turbo was seized, the glow plugs needed to be replaced, a sensor in the tyre was broken, the clutch would probably need to be replaced and the car was unsafe to drive. They said even a basic mechanical check would have identified these issues and that the engine fault signal had been recently cleared before the car had been sold. They said the car should never have been sold to us in that condition. The car required approximately ¬£4000-5000 of repairs. Cinch agreed to take the car back, but it would need to be picked up by a truck as it was not safe for one of their employees to drive the car, an explicit acknowledgment that they had sold us an unsafe car. This resulted in a delay in returning the car. It took a further two weeks to get our refund as the haulage company didn't immediately return the car. I had to personally call the haulage company and arrange to have the car returned to Cinch. Had the engine light not come on during the first two weeks, we would have been stuck with essentially a worthless car. despite returning the car, we are still significantly out of pocket, not to mention the stress, inconvenience and loss of time. I've complained to Cinch but have received no reply on what is a serious failure on their part and an explanation of how this car passed their supposed extensive checks.

Avoid Cinch.  : I took a leap of faith buying a car online. I have bought cars before, but always been present to inspect and test the car. I bought a car from Cinch last year for just under ¬£16k. It was listed with no imperfections and I did all of the usual background checks. In short - I have had nothing but problems since. The car was damaged in transit and Cinch have not been transparent about the extent of the damage and have withheld information. I have had problems with the car, some of which Cinch have addressed, but others remain outstanding. I have spent so much time dealing with different staff and having to repeat and duplicate information. It has been nothing but a headache and waste of my time and money. I cannot recommend Cinch for several reasons - poor customer service, false/misleading advertisement, a lack of accountability and transparency... The list goes on. I would recommend avoiding and buying from elsewhere.

Since then have been stuck in a cycle of contacting Cazoo, being told it would be resolved, and then nothing happening.  When I get back in touch, I'm usually told something along the lines of, "the person dealing with it has left and your case hasn't been reassigned". Last time got as far as being told a refund for the wheel had been approved and I filled out payment details form and returned promptly. No response since and several emails unanswered.  Spent around 50 minutes in call queue without any answer last week, also tried online chat but eventually gave up (nobody available to chat apparently).  Same with chat again today.

Review_Title: Obviously less money than selling privately, but well worth it for the hassle saved
Review_TitleAndText: Obviously less money than selling privately, but well worth it for the hassle saved : Tried many ways of selling my 12 year old Land Rover Freelander 2 but without much success. Webuyanycar were pitching stupid offers that changed by ¬£1000 every other day. Motorway pitched way too high and wouldn't listen to my requests to amend the advert. EBay, marketplace and all those full of timewasters. Went with Carwow and their valuation was realistic. Easy to set up. Within a couple of days I had a few offers lower than reserve. Carwow contacted me to see if I had a counter offer, which I gave them. Within a couple of hours the car was sold for exactly what I was hoping to get from it. No fuss with settling finance, collection or anything. They were very patient with a delay caused by a private plate swap and worked as a mediator between buyer and myself. If you don't want the hassle of selling privately, just give carwow a go. Very pleased with the experience and outcome.

Review_Title: Slick sales process for best price
Review_TitleAndText: Slick sales process for best price : Sold car for over ¬£1k more than trade-in offer. This was in line with the best I could obtain elsewhere. Carwow staff supported the process end to end from posting the ad for auction to the time the vehicle was collected by the winning dealer. Highly recommended as the seller is not charged for the auction and just needs to take a number of photos of the car as guided by the carwow app.

Review_Title: Sales service excellent/ but no hard copy manual
Review_TitleAndText: Sales service excellent/ but no hard copy manual : Peter spent time explaining where everything was on the car, he answered my many questions, helped me set up the link from my phone to the car, and gave me confidence when driving an automatic for the first time, he was really patient. He exceeded my expectations and he was the catalyst to me buying it. The lost star is because Peugeot don't provide a hard copy manual which is a necessity for me ( eye condition) although Peter kindly set up a copy on the system it is not easy to use ( no definitive contents list) and find what you need. Paperless strategy is not appropriate for all customer segments and that should be catered for. In my view that gap is not down to the sales person or branch

Review_Title: Bought my new car from cinch
Review_TitleAndText: Bought my new car from cinch  : Bought my new car from cinch , what a great experience.  Helpful customer service, clear communication and professional service when car was dropped off. Reassurance given if I was not satisfied with car with a 14 day cool down.  Thank you

Take your money and run.  : We bought a jaguar Epace from cinch, advertised as just serviced we thought great nothing to do right now! The car was delivered and this is where the snag list starts. The car arrives dirty the delivery driver said he couldn't get it cleaned because the car wash doesn't take card payments and said can he put 15¬£ in fuel instead. On initial inspection I could see the mileage was over 200 miles than advertised which I get if there driving it to you but I only get 250 miles test drive grace. Paperwork is missing service details, contacted cinch twice via email and to this day had no reply! Phoned them and after pressing a hundred options the only way I could actually get to talk to an agent was to use the cancel my order option but still hasn't been resolved. Had the car two weeks now with more than the one advertised imperfection! Cracking tyres, damaged plastic interior, more than the one advertised scratch on the exterior I know it's not a new car but some of the scuffs are bigger than the one shown in the picture. I feel like no point faffing to try and contact them again! A shame really as buying process was easy to use, website is up to date and straight forward. Just a shame about the lack of actual good old fashioned human customer service.

chris : Motorway were brillant from start to finish everthing was so easy the car was sold the next day picked up in a few days would definitely use them again.

Terrible customer service : Great concept, just a shame the customer service dept is useless! No idea what they are doing. Insist on putting up barriers and do not know how to overcome small problems. Spoke to 3 different members of staff who all assured me everything was correct and ready to advertise. None of them were being honest! Decided to stick my car on Auto Trader

Terrible experience  : I received a reserve price based on very detailed photographs. No offers on day one. Car re-listed the next day and received an offer 15% under reserve price. I phoned Motorway customer services to ask for advice and was told that the most common thing to do was to re-list the car and see if any better offers were received, so I agreed to do that. The car was not entered into the next days sale and my profile appeared to have been deleted. I called to query this and was told that they would not re-list any car that received an offer. When I said that was the advice I was given by their company they said the person who told me that was incorrect and should not have advised me this. The sales team then advised that the best they could do would be to go back to the dealer and see if they would increase their bid by a few hundred pounds. I reluctantly agreed to this and waited for a phone call the next day. No call came and I eventually received an email with an even lower offer than before. Complete waste of time and I am selling my car elsewhere now at a much higher price. I would not recommend this service at all. Seems like a good idea on paper but the reality was very different.

Review_TitleAndText: Purchased a really nice VW Polo : Purchased a really nice VW Polo. Slight disappointment was the car arrived a little dirty because it had been driven 40 miles to get here but we cleaned it straight away so we could check for any damage which there wasn't but the main issue was that the front tyres were on the marker. However after a  quick call with Josh from the Aftercare service team who was really helpful and we took the car to Kwik Fit and two new front tyres were fitted paid for by Cinch so we cant really fault the service given. Updated after our initial review We were contacted by Jazz from the customer experience team who was extremely apologetic for the car arriving dirty and we were kindly offered a good will gesture to compensate  getting the car cleaned. All in all a really great aftercare service and would recommend buying a car from Cinch.

Selling repaired/crashed cars : This is a late review, I bought a car from cinch last year and had a bad feeling after reading all of the reviews stating that prep work was not carried out to a decent standard. I got a mechanic to check the car over and he immediately informed me the front end of the car had undergone extensive repairs. HPI clear, so clearly an undeclared crash of some description. Luckily still within the 14 days to return the vehicle, they had no choice but to collect. I informed them of the reason and the car was straight back up for sale, not declared and for the same price. Be careful what you buy and have your own checks carried out within your return window.

Review_Title: I bought a lovely Volkswagen Tiguan‚Ä¶
Review_TitleAndText: I bought a lovely Volkswagen Tiguan‚Ä¶ : I bought a lovely Volkswagen Tiguan from Cinch. All the imperfections had been corrected so I was really impressed. Unfortunately a week later the engine management light came on. I called Cinch straight away and they booked the car into the local dealer. They apparently had fixed the problem, however a week later the engine management light came back on. Again, called Cinch and they booked the car back in. A week later, the same happened, so I requested to return the car to Cinch. Over a week later, they are now insisting the car goes back in the garage for more diagnostic testing before they can authorise the return. Update: Cinch have now rectified the issue's raised, I now have had my car back from the garage for a couple of weeks with no more problems. Excellent service after a rocky start.

The tyres were a mix of three different budget brands with uneven tread heights and noticeable cracks in the rubber, raising serious safety concerns. Moreover, the brakes appeared worn and emitted sporadic noises, hinting at potential maintenance issues. Overall, I was thoroughly disappointed with the car‚Äôs condition upon arrival and cannot recommend Cinch based on this experience.

Review_Title: Easiest process I have in buying a car
Review_TitleAndText: Easiest process I have in buying a car : Easiest process I have in buying a car, kept me fully informed, answered all my questions and overall a great service! Michelle on collection was really helpful and topped off the experience fully recommend
Great experience  : Being an anxious person I was very reluctant to use an online service for my new car however it has been great all the way through.

Worst experience of my life : Worst experience of my life. Car arrived filthy, driver had no paperwork, nothing to note damage and said to email his manager for which he had no contact details. I contacted cinch and I was offered ¬£25 to have it valeted. I don't know anywhere you can get a car valeted for that price. There was damage not pictured on the listing and different tyre treads on different axels which is illegal but apparently nothing could be done. The car was meant to be 18 months old. I returned the car under the 14 day policy and it was collected over a week later so I had to purchase insurance at cost to myself for it to sit on my drive. I was told the finance element would be sorted but to ring them just in case and I spent hours on hold waiting to speak to both parties about this. I was told when the V5 arrived I would get my deposit back but after weeks of waiting it didn't turn up. When I contacted them again they said the car had never been registered in my name. Again I waited for the money but nothing, so I contacted again. I have spent hours and hours on the phone. I will never buy from this company again and would not recommend them to anyone.

Don't!!! : I bought car from cinch. (21 plate) From beginning vehicle was pulling to the left. Cinch send me for wheel alliance but this didn't help. KWIKFIT refuse to do wheel alliance for cinch account becouse they didn't pay them for latest jobs. After a while I had a lot of warnings lights on dashboard. When I reported them (20th of december) they decided to pickup a car for repair on 15th of December. Car come back to me ones after 2 weeks with same issues. I have got screen photos with "check braking system" check start hill asisst" "check ESC" Al those problems they resolve by changing the battery... just to restart the system. Customer service it is just rude when you trying ask for help with solving problem of the faulty car which they selling. Car coming back to me tomorrow after 46days of being repair. By the customer rights from 2015 I had rights to reject the Car but they don't want listen about this and just providing a false information. Im still with layers, trying to return faulty car. First and last Car from cinch. Dont do my mistake. Don't sign any contract with this company.
The price gets lower & lower! : The price gets lower & lower!

Not great at chasing buyer : Estimated value of the car was quite different from what was actually achieved. Agents weren't particularly helpful when chasing the highest bidder to collect the car - I eventually made contact and chased them myself as Carwow were not particularly useful.

Review_Title: Bad quality checks before selling the car
Review_TitleAndText: Bad quality checks before selling the car : Service was fine and simple, got a new car within a week. However, Cinch needs to conduct more thorough quality checks on their vehicals before selling! after about a week of having the car, i realised the tail light bulb had gone, so i went to check which bulb i needed to replace it with, which i then noticed that the back windscreen had previously been replaced because everytime the boot door was closed you could hear all the bits of glass left over inside the door rattle about, and some bits were managing to pour out all inside the boot. I looked closer and there was little bits of tinted glass left everywhere! All in the crevases and the lining of the boot! Not only did they leave all the shattered glass from the old screen behind, they did half a job replacing it as the back de mister wires were not connected with the new windscreen properly, the new wires were just hanging loose. So that explained why my back window wasn't de-misting in the mornings, and ill probably have to check the fuses now as well after connecting the wires up properly. I get that buying a car second hand has its risks but seriously, either get some mechanics that can do a proper job, or carry out detailed checks of every area of the car before selling! My mother also had a car from cinch and they messed her about by lying to her about the car having service history evidence, saying that they will send her a copy, only to wait to tell her AFTER she had bought the car that they didnt actually have it. Seems quite sketchy to me. I won't be using Cinch again and i won't be recommending it to anyone i know.

Receiving payment for my car : Carwow are all ready to help the process of selling your car but when things haven't gone to plan they are impossible to contact. Have written several emails without reply and phoned a few times to be given an answer machine message that my call cannot be taken at this time.
Stunning service : Stunning service. My car was sold in a very quick and easy process. No hassles

Review_Title: I would totally recommend buying a car‚Ä¶

Review_Title: Started good, let themselves down after
Review_TitleAndText: Started good, let themselves down after : Getting my car setup for auction was easy and straightforward but I only received one bid on the first day which was really low. My car should've been up for auction for 2 further days but I couldn't see anything when I logged in. I phoned up and was reassured my car was on sale but it was the next day that I received notification that it was on sale. The lack of communication and help is really frustrating. My car sold and I received a call from the dealer the next day who said they were too far away to collect the car so it would be booked in with Carwow to collect and I would receive a call. The payment wouldn't be received until the dealer received the car on site and then it depended what time and day. I might have to wait until Monday if it arrived on a Friday. This made me nervous as usually you get paid when a car is picked up. I received emails not a call to book the car in. I had said I was only available AM, the email stated 11am so that was fine. I received a call to let me know I would receive payment within 24 hours maybe sooner from my car pickup time. The day of pickup the driver phoned an hour before and said he wouldn't be with me till 1pm. I have complained but Carwow haven't responded. I also didn't receive the money within 24 hours of collection. Phoned twice and got told 2 different stories. Everything is just so much harder than it should be. I did receive a good price for my car though
KeyPhrases: would receive payment within 24 hours maybe sooner

Review_Title: First time seller - buyers should be held to the bid price unless car is drastically different than advertised
Review_TitleAndText: First time seller - buyers should be held to the bid price unless car is drastically different than advertised : Process was easy and photo guides to get the right shots were really helpful. The car fetched more than I expected and certainly more than other online or main dealers were offering me. But my buyer was a bit suspect. Made a very high offer and tried to take ¬£500 off at the inspection. He based it on the tyres saying he wouldn‚Äôt sell it with the tyres as they were and would have to replace them, however, this was noted in the pictures and the car passed an MOT 2 weeks before with no advisories or issues. It was a really nice, very well cared for car with no marks, rust or damage and very low mileage for her age. You could see the inspector looking for something to knit pick at to justify trying to knock off money. Really made me suspect the buyer was gaming the system- bid high with a motive of knocking money off when they are on your door step. That part made me feel uncomfortable. Added to the fact that we are quite rural and I agreed to pick the driver up from the train station so once he was all the way out here so I was in a position of either take his offer or drive him back to station and start the process again.

Review_Title: All's well that ends well - hold your nerve!
Review_TitleAndText: All's well that ends well - hold your nerve! : The initial valuation is a 'come on'. The reserve price for the auction on Monday 4 March was recommended as some ¬£300 less. The reserve price was achieved, but no more! Nevertheless, I was more than satisfied with the amount bid. The successful bidder did not make contact within the 48 hour period and it became necessary to find out why. This was not so easy, despite having had contact from a member of the 'Collections' team. Repeated attempts to make contact using the phone number he provided were met with an announcement that the number was unavailable at that time. My phone shows that I made 14 calls to the number, only one of which was successful. As a result of the prompting I did get a call from the purchaser. The car was eventually collected and paid for 7 days after the auction without any argument about the price.

Review_Title: Liars. DO NOT BUY A CAR FROM CAZOO
Review_TitleAndText: Liars. DO NOT BUY A CAR FROM CAZOO : Car was delivered yesterday. Noticed straight away that it didn't have a couple of features that were listed on the advert but we'd looked at a few cars of the same model so we just thought maybe we confused it with one of the others.  Looked back on the listing and there are 5 major features on the listing that the car just doesn't have. Found a couple of (admittedly minor) issues in the past 24 hours so tried to get in touch. Filled in the online form as advised by one of the advisors on the chat and got an automatic reply saying I'll get a response in FOUR days. 7 day money back guarantee makes sense now, can't get your money back if you can't contact them can you!

Review_Title: Easy process but would struggle to think again.
Review_TitleAndText: Easy process but would struggle to think again. : Updated Review - process to purchase the vehicle was a simple process from beginning to end. When I received the vehicle I was asked if I wanted to test drive to ensure I was 100% sure with my purchase otherwise they would take it away, which was a nice touch. Following this, I had an issue with my breaks so went onto a live chat to understand how I raise this and the process - where was told I had a 90 day warranty. The car was booked into the garage and was awaiting Cinch‚Äôs approval for the repairs. The repair was rejected as my breaks were covered under 30 days and not the 90 days as previously explained to me. On review, I raised the issue at day 32 but queried the process before this and it was still rejected. I then had to pay out my own pocket for the repair but then Milly and Joe from Cinch contacted me to understand my experience and they were appalled at the service I received. They then ensured I was refunded for the repair ASAP to ensure my experience was not fully negative. I would need to think again about buying a car from Cinch but was extremely grateful for the after care I received. If only this was rectified at the time, I wouldn‚Äôt think twice about buying my next car from there.

Faultless service  : Such a smooth process from start to finish.  Detailed description of the car, easy to purchase and choose a delivery slot.  I was sent all the relevant information required to tax and insure the vehicle in advance.  A nice lady called Michelle texted us on delivery day to give a rough window of her arrival time.  The car was immaculate, smelling like a new car.  I would definitely recommend Cinch based on my very positive experience.

Review_Title: Overall good experience only one slight snag.
Review_TitleAndText: Overall good experience only one slight snag. : After being let down by another car dealer (Motorpoint terrible btw) I decided to try Cinch, They had a good range of cars available and I liked that they had plenty of pictures of them as well as highlighting the imperfections for transparency. Placing the order and applying for the finance was an easy faultless process. Cinch provided all the necessary information to inform me of what I needed to do before delivery day. On delivery day the drop off driver was polite and called me a hour or two before to inform me he was on his way and arrived exactly on time. The only issue as to why not 5 Stars is that the imperfections where not catalogued correctly on the posting. They only showed that there was a scratch near the gearstick. However there was also a small crack in the right side rear light casing, as well as a large scuff on the inside of the rear window and multiple badly painted over scratches on the boot hatch. These where only minor cosmetic issues however so I am happy to overlook them as the car performs very well after a week of driving it but think its important to make aware they may try pass these things off!
Really easy process! : Really easy process!

Tried to call Cinch straight away and no answer after 20 minutes on hold. Sent WhatsApp messages and again ignored. Review_Title: All started really well until I sold‚Ä¶
Review_TitleAndText: All started really well until I sold‚Ä¶ : All started really well until I sold the vehicle‚Ä¶. I was supposed to hear from the dealer within 2 days, after 3 days I‚Äôd heard nothing‚Ä¶ made me feel a bit sceptical about the process. If the dealer is this lax about picking up the car, it gave me 0 confidence that they would settle my finance in a timely manner. I cancelled the sale as I felt very uncomfortable about the process and went to WBAC instead, whilst I got less money, I felt much more comfortable with the process.
Great experience : Super quick, really easy to use platform. Got a reasonable price for my car and completed in under a week start to finish.  Highly recommend and would use again!

Such an easy process : Decided to sell my SUV, great car, 7yr old from new but was thinking about selling to update.  Contacted Motorway for a valuation who came back quickly with an impressive quote that held for 7 days, which I appreciated as this gave me time to think about what I wanted to do, had I been pressurised I probably wouldn't have listed the car.  Towards the end of the 7day period I thought why not! so decided to download the app & with its easy to follow instructions.  Following submission of photographs the quote was reviewed & revised by only a couple of hundred pounds due to some scuffing on the alloys which after 7yrs on the road I thought was fair & reasonable, the revised quote came in at ¬£10,200 which I was still very pleased with but was braced for an offer of around ¬£500 to a ¬£1000 less at auction.  On the day of auction I received notification that the car had in fact met its price as stated above which I was delighted with.  The dealer contacted me & arranged pick up within a couple of days &  after a full inspection of the car & before the driver left, the money was in the bank, cant believe how slick the whole operation was from start to finish.

Scam don't waste your time  : Pretty easy to set up profile and photograph car, however don't expect anywhere near what they offer you. Was told my car had been sold for ¬£200 more than the reserve price. Waited almost 4 days before the dealer got in touch then had to waot almost a further 2 weeks before it was collected to then be told they were offering me ¬£1200 less than the original offer despite the car being exactly the same as the listing. Seems a coincidence the price they wanted to give me was the same as what WBAC were offering. An absolute scam, took almost 3 weeks to get offered pennies. Save your time and sell private.

Review_Title: Harry assisted me in picking up my new‚Ä¶
Review_TitleAndText: Harry assisted me in picking up my new‚Ä¶ : Harry assisted me in picking up my new Mercedes in Chertsey this evening, he was extremely professional and knowledgable. Made it a smooth and enjoyable car buying process. Thanks a lot!

Well where do I start : Well where do I start . I bought a Range Rover evoque and picked it up from Manchester on the 15th April 2023 . Terrible experience was told on arrival my new car was getting valeted and they were running behind by about an hour. I parked my old car right next to the one I was buying, the lies started there I should‚Äôve jumped in my old car and drove away .they brought my new car into showroom and the fob key needed a new battery.wasn‚Äôt shown any features of car , I drove car home and unknown to me once I pressed the key fob to lock the car I heard two beeps thinking the car was locked . I had a hospital appointment that day I drove car onto hospital carpark I pressed the fob thinking car was locked . The car wasn‚Äôt locked and had a drivers door modular problem it took 3 months to get it fixed , during the 3 months cazoo warranty I noticed the front lights passenger side wasn‚Äôt working and the dpf / heat shield had fallen of the car .the car was booked into a local garage for repair over 4 times at a cost of over 3 thousand pounds which was under warranty the car then had to go to Land Rover main dealer to fix the problem the local garage couldn‚Äôt and wasn‚Äôt interested .I had also asked for car to go to main dealer from start which cazoo refused to do , the passenger front light which I was told was a loose connection from the local garage .part of my compensation was a free service and mot I had the service done in October from kwik fit and the mot February 5th from kwik fit .the car failed the mot with the front  passenger light the full light has to be replaced at a cost of 970 pounds , I‚Äôm still waiting for a reply from cazoo to address the issues, I‚Äôd like to know why my car had passed the previous cazoo mot with the door modular and the front passenger light and also the dpf filter. Also how come none of these defects were picked up during cazoo 300 point check which they state they carry out on every vehicle before sale . I have also sent over 100 emails and endless phone calls .ps I‚Äôve only had car 10 months and over 4 thousand pounds worth of work done .

Review_Title: Not helpful in getting issues resolved in a timely manner
Review_TitleAndText: Not helpful in getting issues resolved in a timely manner : Car was delivered on time and was lovely and clean. The delivery driver said what a lovely drive he had coming from Oxford to Manchester. Also that the car had noisy window wipers but that was the car model. Drove the car at 60mph on the motorway and the car wheel and driver seat was shaking and vibrating quite intensely. Which was a worry. After numerous calls, whatapp chats and emails they booked in the garage where was discovered if needed completely balancing on all wheels, this resolved the vibrating but also there was creaking when driving slowly around corners or over speed bumps. This has not been resolved. The garage said that the inside wheel was damaged and needed replacing immediately. That was 7 days ago. Cinch after countless emails and delays have emailed to say they will replace the wheel and as yet no date in the garage and no firm plan to get the creaking addressed. Additionally the roof bar was assessed when the wheel balancing was corrected and needs a body work specialist and there is no plan for this either. It‚Äôs really concerning I have paid in full 19k to have all of these issues. I did want to send back as suspension could be costly. But I am being told 7-10 days to get money back after returning the car. I have tried and tried to get this resolved pre the 14 days and this has just been dragged out with poor response times. The staff I have dealt with on calls have been lovely but everything is so slow.
The whole process was seamless : The whole process was seamless, I didn't have any problems whatsoever. Customer service was great, helpful. Thumbs up from me üëçüèΩ

Review_Title: Recently bought a car from Cazoo and‚Ä¶
Review_TitleAndText: Recently bought a car from Cazoo and‚Ä¶ : Recently bought a car from Cazoo and was initially very impressed with the service. It was easy to choose the vehicle, arrange the finance and the collection. However since purchasing it‚Äôs been a completely different experience. After leaving the forecourt it was clear the car hadn‚Äôt been checked properly as there were issues with the brakes, issues with tracking and some issues with the steering. I was advised to take the car to Kwik Fit for them to diagnose the issue and fix as they have an account and they (Cazoo) wouldn‚Äôt be able to see me as they were too busy. I followed their advice and still haven‚Äôt managed to resolve all of the issues, which is awful when purchasing a used car from an approved dealer who state they carry out a 300 point check on all used vehicles. I‚Äôm in the process of trying to return the vehicle as this many issues with a vehicle purchased less than two weeks ago is a red flag. I‚Äôd advise anyone considering Cazoo to do some research and testing before going ahead.

I would deffinately recommend motorway instead of we buy any car who offered alot less than motorway, and that was with describing any problems with the vehicle.

Review_Title: Do not buy a car from Cinch
Review_TitleAndText: Do not buy a car from Cinch : Do not buy a car from Cinch! I bought my car last year and within a month of warranty, the car was faulty. I reported the fault and the car was booked in for repair at a garage that Cinch recommended. The car wasn‚Äôt fixed, and this has been an ongoing reoccurring issue for just under a year, the 4th and most recent time I reported it, Cinch seem to have washed their hands with covering the cost of repairs claiming that the latest diagnosis isn‚Äôt related to the issue when the garage have told me it is. No courtesy car provided throughout this inexplicably frustrating and inconvenient situation, leaving me unable to get to work as the car is left in the garage for up to a week at a time. Cinch are awful to contact, they do not reply to emails, and every time I‚Äôve phoned I‚Äôve been on hold for a minimum of 50 minutes before I get through to someone. My car is still sat the garage as I am refusing to pay for the cost of repair. Not to mention when the car was delivered to me- it was covered in tiny specs of white paint on the bonnet/front bumper, caused by an issue in their valeting system. To which I was asked by the driver if I was okay with, and told‚Ä¶ ‚Äúit will come off with some elbow grease‚Äù. I will seek legal advice and be involving ACAS if the issue isn‚Äôt resolved.

Review_Title: After having a very smooth transaction‚Ä¶
Review_TitleAndText: After having a very smooth transaction‚Ä¶ : After having a very smooth transaction and communications with cinch I was counting down the day till my new car arrived,  when it did I was disappointed the driver that brought the car was fantastic no issues there at all ,all the disappointed issues were with the car it was exactly as advertised all spot on . But the finer points were missing which you would expect on a new car firstly all the car mats had been removed, the jack and wheel brace were missing,  very little diesel only 65 miles worth, then the car itself hadn't been valeted the outside was grubby inside wasn't too bad but the wheels and discs were the worse hadn't been touched in weeks, it cost me a ¬£100 for a valet and ¬£75 for mats I haven't been able to find a jack yet, it took me half a day to remove all of the tar spots along the sides of the car. Many may think this is petty but its that sort of service that makes the difference on a 26k car oh sorry I did get a free umbrella üåÇ  come on cinch just finish off what is a excellent service overall. Addendum after a very pleasant phone call from mMilly lee from cinch she kindly pointed out various items mainly they can only sell on what comes with the vehicle in my case no jack etc or mats are included from the manufacturer and the normal policy is to supply enough fuel for the customer to comfortably get to a service station, all of which I accepted unconditionally. Milly also reimbursed my money for car mats and valet. So thank you milly and cinch for your quick and efficient response I can now enjoy my new car and would certainly recommend you to friends and family cheers.

Review_Title: We chose to use Cinch to simplify the process
Review_TitleAndText: We chose to use Cinch to simplify the process : After carefully selecting our desired car, we chose to use Cinch to simplify the process and have the vehicle delivered to our doorstep. The car was purchased on the 1st of February. However, on the scheduled delivery day the 15th of February, we were left in the dark with no updates from Cinch. Upon reaching out to them, we discovered that a logistics issue had caused a delay in the delivery. Despite being promised a morning update with a delivery timeframe, we were informed of a new delivery date set five days later. While this was disappointing, we were willing to wait for the car we truly wanted.
KeyPhrases: new delivery date set five days later

Review_TitleAndText: Started well but then.... : First the good bits. Purchasing online was easy and the two lads who dropped the car off were great.

Terrible Customer Service : I purchased a car from Cinch two weeks ago. I would suggest to any prospective buyer to not trust any car listed with no imperfections, as that's certainly not true. After being delivered 6 days later than originally planned the car I received, though in fine working order, is covered in small scratches that have been 'repaired' in a paint colour that doesn't match and looks really messy. I was assured on delivery day that this would be resolved by their repair team. I chased a first time to discover they hadn't forwarded my issue to the repair team at all. That was 'sorted' a week ago but despite repeated attempts I am still waiting to hear from the repairs team. The customer service is dreadful - I have been passed around between various members of staff, all of whom have assured me of timelines that have not once been met. The customer phone line and emails are not responded to - the only way to get in touch is through WhatsApp, which has very slow response times and will kick you out if you don't respond quickly.

Could be better‚Ä¶ : The price that was offered originally seemed a great price however what was deducted from that for very minor imperfections to reach our reserve was ridiculous. We were offered ¬£3 over the reserve price which was insulting so we rejected this offer.  We re-listed 4 weeks later after addressing the minor imperfections however this was not straightforward.  I was made to feel I was being deceptive in my description of my car.  I was also questioned why I hadn‚Äôt accepted the first offer made and was advised I wouldn‚Äôt be able to list it again. We were offered a lesser value price than the original price however I got offered a good bit more than our reserve price.  If time had been on my side I‚Äôd have sold privately and would definitely have got more!

Your work was not bad : Your work was not bad. Your dealer not so good started off with an offer 5700 which he dropped to 4600 before he visited. On arrival he just tried to downgrade the car he finally offered 3700. He was told no go so he went and sat in his car for an hour. He returned to offer 4050 I reluctantly accepted.

Review_Title: Customer service was extremely poor but improved
Review_TitleAndText: Customer service was extremely poor but improved : Customer service was extremely poor, trying to contact took over 3 hours, car arrived with unroadworthy tyres and took over two weeks and countless demands to get the work completed resulting in an ultimatum of either get this work authorised or commence the return procedure eventually cinch approved the tyre change, it has now been sorted however the reversing camera has now stopped working and I expect another fight on my hands :(. 23/04/2024 update, customer service got in touch with me to sort out the issues I had. Assured me my comments regarding their WhatsApp service had been passed on and the service has improved. I‚Äôve not had to deal with them again so cannot confirm if it has improved. The camera was fixed it did take another month however that was because the part had to come from Sweden so nothing to do with cinch however their Customer service team kept in touch and Milly was particularly helpful. I can now say I‚Äôm very happy with the vehicle. I would recommend speaking to customer service direct if u have any problems as they were able to sort the problem instead of going round in circles on WhatsApp. I‚Äôve improved the stars as my problems have resolved however the condition the car was delivered in and cinch‚Äôs initial response was extremely poor.

Review_Title: Poor communication car delivered in dangerous condition
Review_TitleAndText: Poor communication car delivered in dangerous condition  : Car not serviced prior to arrival, 2 tyres under legal limit despite advising they would be rectified on quality checks.  2 tyres very near to limit, cracked windscreen which was not detailed and multiple scratches on a car sold with no imperfections.  Advised we would receive a phone call on the morning with a time but no call received only call was when the driver was ten minutes away so had to wait by the phone all day.  Telephone waiting time over an hour before giving up so have contacted via email and complaints to hopefully rectify the issues.  Car also did not come with service book or tools for removing tyres.  Car was sold as showroom condition my exchange car was in a much better condition.  Contact details including my number left on the email sent.  Last car was with Cazoo which was a lot easier experience and much better checks and service.  Hoping the issues can be resolved promptly otherwise I will be seeking a refund which could take upto 14 days to be refunded which will leave me without a car for 2 weeks.  For something that you should look forward to has been a nightmare.

Review_Title: Absolute shambles from start to finish
Review_TitleAndText: Absolute shambles from start to finish : Absolute shambles from start to finish. The process is not as straight forward as the advert would have you believe. After taking lots of pictures and filling in forms on the App, you then need to call them and go over exactly the same stuff again that you have just filled in. I was then told my car would go to auction the next day and was given a 'reserve price' (which is not the minimum they will accept for the car!) this didn't happen the next day and instead went to auction the day after. I then was sent an email with the highest bid and asked if i wanted to accept it. it was close to the reserve price so i did accept it. I was told my trader would be in touch within 48 hours to arrange collection. 8 days went by and no contact despite me emailing and calling the trader. Motorway seemed unable to contact their 'Trusted Trader' either. Eventually the car was auctioned another twice before i reluctantly accepted an offer that was ¬£400 below the reserve price. Around 3 weeks after my initial auction date, this 'Trusted Trader' turned up and tried to take another ¬£150 off for some made up oil leak he said was present. i told him no way that was happening and off he went. I sold my car privately the next day. What a complete waste of time and effort.

Review_Title: DO NOT BUY A CAR WITH CAZOO.
Review_TitleAndText: DO NOT BUY A CAR WITH CAZOO. : I'm utterly appalled by my experience with Cazoo, and I feel compelled to share this so others don't fall into the same trap. Initially, everything seemed smooth and promising, but the moment I raised a genuine concern about a disturbing noise from the brakes within their so-called "7-day return period," the true colors of Cazoo's customer service‚Äîor the lack thereof‚Äîwere shockingly revealed. They had the audacity to email me, suggesting I should continue driving the car for another two weeks, assuring me the issue would magically resolve itself. Naively trusting their advice, I waited, only to be slapped with a ludicrous excuse when I followed up. Suddenly, it's "wear and tear," and now it's my problem to fix? This is beyond unacceptable; it's downright deceitful and irresponsible. Cazoo has shown they have no interest in standing by their products or their promises. Review_TitleAndText: My car arrived smelling of smoke and‚Ä¶ : My car arrived smelling of smoke and with a broken window, I immediately reported the issues to Cinch and have been waiting for nearly a month now and have heard nothing back. Abysmal after care  : I hate leaving negative reviews but here goes. I got my new car from Cinch today and it's beautiful, but, the driver literally took my keys, handed me mine and legged it. So off the bat, not a great start. Took the car for a drive and was lovely, then I hit 63mph and it shook the bones out of me to the point where it was hard to control. I called their support 3 times and each time I was cut off after exactly 1h 1m. I was furious. I called again but chose to pick the, buy a car option and it rang twice and had an answer. So  great to sell you something but no interest in hearing issues I think. So tomorrow I have to take my car to Kwik fit to have tracked and balanced at their expense. Buying my car was easy as was my trade in. But purely because of their lack of after sales, I personally wouldn't ever buy from them again. ***UPDATE**** Took the car to Quik fit. They set alignment etc. I took it for a drive and the steering wobble stopped but the car is still shaking the bones at between 63 and 70mpg. Terrified to drive it. They are so bad that they reply on trustpilot to get further information but can't make a call or answer. For anyone with issues with this lot, call the number for buying a car and they answer. I have since found another issue where my wing mirrors won't close. I now have no car for work. That a joke of a company. Come and take your junk away and refund me like it says on your 14 day guarantee. ***New update*** They have offered to repair my car, the one that was delivered that I drove no more than 29 mins, go figure, but can't pick it up until 9th of April. Today I have started a return. I really think they need examine their ways of working.

The panel was falling off, severe scratches on both front windows (so bad you could feel the indent), hole in the carpet on the drivers side floor, rips in the leather of the gearstick, stains all over both front seats‚Ä¶.. seriously I could go on! 2 phone calls to customer services from the agent and apparently they didn‚Äôt want to know! The agent insisted I sign for the vehicle (agreeing it was sold as advertised, which I‚Äôm not daft enough to do) and bring it back in 7 days, stating that this was the most straight forward option. How on earth this car passed ‚Äúquality‚Äù checks is anyone‚Äôs guess. I‚Äôve never been so disappointed in the customer service received by completely disinterested members of staff. And a car being sold as apparent excellent condition was just lies. But don‚Äôt worry‚Ä¶.. the agent told me the pictures are normally ‚Äúpretty accurate‚Äù‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ just not in this case!!!!! Currently awaiting the pick up of said car that is being swiftly returned after being owned for just 90 minutes! Thanks Cazoo for the costs involved and the completely wasted time.

Review_Title: Easy to list and trusted/vetted dealers who bid for your vehicle. Recommended
Review_TitleAndText: Easy to list and trusted/vetted dealers who bid for your vehicle. Recommended : It was very easy to list my car on app and Carwow website. The following day I called to confirm vehicle details and it went to auction the next day. Got 3 offers but I did not get my reserve price. I decided to accept highest offer (only ¬£300 difference from my reserve price) which was from a main Nissan Renault dealership. I uploaded all required docs and pictures the same day and then received a call from dealership within 10 mins to ask for my bank account details and arrange collection date. Excellent service! This was organised within 2 days and my car was collected the following week via a 3rd party vehicle collection Company. The dealership arranged payment within 2 hours of collection. A special thank you to Kieran from Carlisle Nissan Renault (dealership who bought my car) who was efficient, friendly and after contact was made. a pleasure to deal with. Would sell again via CarWow. Excellent service all round.

Good experience  : Generally everything went like clockwork. The website is easy to navigate from both a buying and a selling point of view. I definitely got a lot more money for my car than that offered by the main dealer. My only slight criticism ( hence 4 stars rather than 5) is that having sold the car, submitted the paperwork, and then been told that the paperwork had been approved the first I knew that the car was being picked up was when Engineius rang me to tell me that they couldn‚Äôt pick the car up the following day! Once that was sorted the whole delivery process was seamless with the money in the bank before the car left our house. I would definitely use Carwow again.

Review_Title: Simple ordering and a terrific vehicle
Review_TitleAndText: Simple ordering and a terrific vehicle : The ordering and payment process was easy, and on day of delivery the driver made sure I knew how things worked before leaving. The vehicle itself was in superb condition inside and out, and so far driving it has been a pleasure.
Excellent service of professionalism‚Ä¶ : Excellent service of professionalism from start to finish, always on hand to answer questions promptly and accurately.

What a shambles : What a shambles, AVOID! I paid for a car on 24th January and delivery was 12th February. On the morning of delivery they called to say my car wasn‚Äôt up to standard, despite being photographed for their website, worts n‚Äôall!

Buying cars without the FAFF (not) : Cinch tried to avoid paying for a service. I bought a honda 67 plate CRV before Christmas 23. I paid the top price because this car was low mileage and had a 'full dealer service history'. When delivered the service log showed that prior to delivery Cinch had contracted, BCA Fleet services (part of the same group), to do a pre delivery service (engine oil and filter change). The car was actually due for a 6 year service (a much more extensive service costing over ¬£1200). Having contacted them to resolve the issue they arranged for the car to be inspected by  the local honda dealership. This identified a problem with the rear brakes and confirmed the 6 year service was several months overdue. Cinch, aftercare authorised the break repair but declined to do the overdue service. This process continued over nearly 3 months. Unable to get Cinch to undertake the service I had no option but to resort to the courts. Once the claim was submitted online which landed on the Cinch complaints department desk, within 90min had offered to undertake the service 'without prejudice'. To their credit this work was eventually done.  It did include the extra brake work which was undertaken at the same time and turned out to be more extensive than at first sight. This extra work was authorised by Cinch without any trouble.

We were p/x'ing our old car and the process of pointing out flaws & imperfections on both cars was friendly and easy - there were no nasty surprises or haggling. Based on our experience so far I'd definitely recommend Cazoo and will look to do so again in the future. Hopefully our new car will work out well over the coming days, weeks and months. This is our first electric car and it was especially helpful that Johno was knowledgeable and passion about EVs.

Review_TitleAndText: I would recommend cinch, but caution to not pin your hopes on the initial delivery date. : Very happy with my new car, however there were some snags with the service. My new car was delayed on the morning of delivery, so pretty short notice and the message that was left informing me of this was fairly apathetic. However, the customer service team were great on the phone and they kept me informed and promptly rebooked delivery. Delivery of the car itself was good, quick and easy. I've had the car about a week and I'm very happy with it. The car was advertised as only have Apple Carplay, but it also connects to my Google phone with Android Auto which is a bonus! I would recommend cinch, but caution to not pin your hopes on the initial delivery date.

Review_Title: Not poor, rather non-existent communication and customer care
Review_TitleAndText: Not poor, rather non-existent communication and customer care : I have been involved in an accident 4 years ago, before Cazoo took over from Drover. Since Cazoo took over, I have had to constantly initiate contact, asking if the matter has been resolved and deposit can be returned. Never, even once, did they write to me first. When the case was resolved, funds have been sent to Cazoo and I was eligible for the return of half of the deposit. Unsurprisingly they have not thought it would be decent of them to contact me and it has likely been 6 months since this is when I was last asked for some finalizing details by their insurer. After getting in touch with them, there were no details of this under my name or account, but in the end it was stated the deposit would be in my bank account within 10 business days. It has almost been a month, there is no sign of money, or a reply since asking for an update. When I spoke to somebody on the phone on Monday last week, I was told I will be contacted the same evening or the next day. You guessed it, it is Saturday as I write this.
