Review_Title: This is my 5th vehicle from cinch
Review_TitleAndText: This is my 5th vehicle from cinch : This is my 5th vehicle from cinch, the last two have had no less than 3 problems per car. Cinch advise they check all vehicles before leaving to the customer, in most cases I‚Äôm sure this is right but the issues experienced are all minor issues that should have been caught on the checks, as advised to cinch, the engineers need to slow down and take some pride in their workmanship and catch these minor snags before sending the vehicles out. This time body parts missing, door handles hanging off and keys not working, these things should have been seen on a check. (I paid for the last repairs as I got absolutely no where with cinch repairing them) If the valet/checking staff would just take a little more pride in their job, this would impact the aftercare team and there wouldn‚Äôt be so many issues to report especially when it takes nearly an hour to get through to a member of the team. People myself included have already lost patience by the time they get through. Cinch come on, brief those staff members on customer service and values, go back to how you were with my first 3 cars in 21-22, since you have expanded, your services have gone downhill (and very fast). Bring back the old fashioned values you had when you first opened when buying a car from you was a delightful and exciting experience, now (this will be my last) just fills you with dread.

Review_Title: Ok, just don't get sucked in by the teaser valuation.
Review_TitleAndText: Ok, just don't get sucked in by the teaser valuation. : While on balance I think the sale price I got for my car was fair, I didn't like the way Motorway went about it.  First, they tease you in with a valuation based solely on your mileage - and their valuation here is of course great.  Then, when they've reeled you in and you put in the actual condition (and they want to know EVERYTHING), you of course get a lower value - not exceptionally lower (I only had kerb damaged wheels).  At this point you're still thinking it's a great value.  Then they put it 'up for auction' and THAT is where you get brought right back down to earth and you end up with a valuation that's probably less than you'd get if you listed it and sold it yourself.  The difference between the teaser and actual price was 1,600 for me.

Unfair to Home Mechanics‚Ä¶ : Car was valued by Motorway at ¬£1000 more than WBAC. The car was a 2011 plate I'd bought from new and did my own servicing once out of guarantee. However I was not credited for full service history even though the service book was signed and dated and I had all the receipts and invoices for oil and parts used over the years. This is unfair and limits the number of dealers who bid. I looked after my car better than any garage would have done. Motorway need to review their policy on Home Mechanics who are skilled and thorough and have the paperwork to verify all the work has been done. The car did sell and the dealer tried to haggle the price down but I refused. They paid the final auction price which was about ¬£500 lower than a fair private sale figure. Picked it up within a week of the auction, so I suppose a reasonable result. Office/phone ladies were helpful.

Review_Title: Some good, a lot of bad
Review_TitleAndText: Some good, a lot of bad : We collected our VW Golf from the Bristol showroom last week. I'll start with the good: as you'd expect, the buying process was pretty straight-forward, and within 10 minutes we had our confirmation email -- very exciting -- we received a series of automated emails over the next few days telling us what to bring, how to tax the car etc., which was useful and meant that we arrived at the showroom prepared. The car itself, despite the 9 reported imperfections, looked fantastic, you can almost convince yourself you're being brand new as you drive it out of the showroom.

Terrible after care service : Terrible after care service. Lodged a problem with car - unable to drive - less than two months after delivery - within 3 month warranty - quoted FOUR WORKING DAYS - with a weekend in between that will be nearly a FULL WEEK before any contact. As this rate the warranty will be expired BEFORE they even look at the car - JUST APPALLING - DON'T BUY FOR CAZOO if you are swayed by the warranty.

Review_Title: I would recommend checking the adverts in detail prior to purchasing
Review_TitleAndText: I would recommend checking the adverts in detail prior to purchasing : I initially found purchasing a car through cinch disappointing but their CX team rectified the situation after I posted this review (subsequently updated and a star added). Our car arrived without any floor mats and without a spare wheel (all the bolts were lying inside the vehicle). Their customer support staff took a while to get in touch and were not forthcoming in providing the missing parts as they were not listed on the advertisement, and said cinch would not be providing them. For a high value purchase (over ¬£20k) I would expect the advert to explicitly state if some key parts of the car would not be supplied. After posting this review I was promptly contacted by their team and offered a reimbursement for the cost of floor mats and to have our wiper blades replaced, which I also mentioned were not smooth. There was no cover for the spare wheel as a tyre repair kit came with the car. Overall their CX could do with a bit of improvement but in the end I‚Äôm a happy customer and the buying process was really easy.

Less than Cinch promised : The Cinch website was easy to navigate and the car I selected was described fully and accurately. Also, they gave a competitive trade-in value for my old car. The paperwork and financial transaction were very straightforward and felt secure. I chose for the car to be delivered in an afternoon slot. I was also lead to believe the delivery driver would take me through the workings of the car. The car was ( slightly inconveniently) delivered in the morning and the young lady new nothing about the car, saying it was the first electric car she had driven. She was, however, very clear and competent regarding the DVLA paperwork, which went through without a hitch.  The car was very well valeted but came with no PDI inspection report or service record. I have replaced two tyre valve covers and the windscreen wipers, which I don't feel strongly about as it is a second hand car. So far, the car has performed faultlessly.

Review_TitleAndText: Really pleasant company to deal with : Really pleasant company to deal with. Customer service was great. David the delivery driver took time to show me round the car. Zero aftercare - zero customer care : I bought a vehicle from Cazoo in November 23. On 12 Jan it suffered a catastrophic engine failure on a major road, which nearly resulted in a truck piling into it. The car was recovered to a local garage who carried out an initial assessment and discovered that there was no compression on any cylinder - indicating a cylinder head failure.  They also noted that, in their opinion, the car had not been properly serviced in around 3-years (judging by the age and state of the oil filter) - so much for the comprehensive 300-point pre-delivery inspection!  The issue was reported to Cazoo through their website and I received an acknowledgement stating that their 'friendly' customer care team would be in contact within 4-working days; no such contact was made.  Three more things to note:  1.  Despite them saying that the quickest way to reach them was via live chat, this function does not work; 2. Their WhatsApp messaging service (which they also recommend) is also 'currently unavailable'; I have now spent over 3-hours in total on the telephone listening to the same drivel message over and over again.  I contacted them via email and received a response stating that 'they would deal with my issue within 5-working-days' and 'not to email again as it clogs up their inbox'.  5-days passed and nothing from Cazoo.  On the sixth day, I received a call stating that the car would be picked up and transported to their Northampton centre; nothing has happened.  It is now 17-days since I initially reported the issue and nothing has happened.  Funnily enough, the 90-day warranty expires next week - I wonder if they are waiting for that so they can absolve themselves of all responsibility; I wouldn't put it past them.  I tried calling the Sales team this morning - amazingly they picked up within 5-seconds.... but when I explained that I was calling about a warranty issue I was told 'that's not my department'.  Cazoo is only interested in taking your money.  Their aftercare service is appalling - almost non-existent.  I'm now having to go down the route of producing a legal challenge, which is going to take even more of my time, but I see no other option as they will not respond to any of my communications nor even attempt to resolve the issue.  I've also now been without a car for three-weeks.  Please, please think twice before buying from Cazoo.  If I could give zero stars, I would.

Review_Title: Sold me a car with a recall and major safety issue!
Review_TitleAndText: Sold me a car with a recall and major safety issue! : Illegally sold me a car with an existing recall on it and needless to say didn't make me aware of it. Problems with braking system and ABS but because of the recall no garage would touch it. Been an absolute nightmare in getting my money back and didn't even have the decency to give a call or respond to my emails to check we were OK and apologise for the situation after the brakes failed! Only just got my money back, and I've had to chase constantly. I'm also out of pocket for a ¬£1,200 electric charging point that I can no longer use (the Ford Kuga was the only Hybrid I was happy to consider having so my replacement car will be petrol and thus the charger is now redundant). I was told this would be reimbursed within a day or so, but 2 weeks later I'm still chasing for an update from this illusive team I've been passed to.

What a First Class experience. : What a service that Carwow offer to enable you to sell your vehicle. We had already used Carwow to save over ¬£2,500 on the cost of our new vehicle, which was on order for nearly 5 months. At the time we did not ask for a p/x valuation but did once the new vehicles delivery date was known. Their offer was reasonable but did not wow us at all. So we looked to Carwow and were able to easily set the advert, including all the relevant information and a number of pictures of the car. We were then contacted by their support team, where the details were reviewed and they asked us to set a reserve price. I thought I was being a little cheeky in setting the reserve I did but the team told me it was within the range that comparable cars had been sold. This was all done on a Friday evening and we were told the car would be in the auction the next Monday. Email communication was excellent and the car sold for ¬£2,100 more than the p/x quote. Communication from the buying trader was almost instant and a convenient collection time was agreed. The dealer asked for copies of certain documents and Carwow emailed a couple of times to ensure collection process was going to plan. The collection took place perfectly and at the agreed time and we had none of this "We Buy Any Car" rubbish where they quote one price and then when you present the car knock you down for anything they can find. Finally, Carwow team again checked that everything had gone smoothly. Really impressed with the service and the support that you get from Carwow. They helped making selling our vehicle a really pleasurable experience.

Review_Title: I bought a BMW M3 Competition for what‚Ä¶
Review_TitleAndText: I bought a BMW M3 Competition for what‚Ä¶ : I bought a BMW M3 Competition for what at the time seemed a great price. I‚Äôve had nothing but problems since. That car was delivered when they said which was great. Then the problems started, it drove badly for a start, steering was off, pulling all over the road and the brakes shuddered. Condition of car was ok but the rear spoiler was trashed which it didn‚Äôt show properly on the images. Contacted cinch and was told to book into kwick-fit under warranty. Turns out their account is on the stop with them as they owe money so nobody would look at my car. I took it to a local specialist at my own cost in the end. Turns out the car had 1 broken coil spring and one badly corroded, alignment was miles out and rear wheel had a bad camber. Brakes needed stripping down and cleaned as they were badly pitted from being stood. So much to being checked before delivery. Unroadworthy car delivered. They then took my car away and had it for over 4 weeks and weren‚Äôt giving me a courtesy car. After many calls messages asking for my money back I was given a fiat 500 from enterprise which was a joke. How do I fit 2 children with seats and any form of luggage in that! I then subsidised to get a 4 door car out of my own pocket. When I eventually got my car back they‚Äôd done 1 spring and spoiler only. No tracking, no alignment and a badly corroded spring still. Absolute joke. Took it back to the local garage and I‚Äôve since had to get the spring done which turns out was actually broken but out of sight. I‚Äôve also had the alignment done. I‚Äôm over ¬£1k out of pocket from these cowboys. How anyone can think this is acceptable to sell a ¬£30k+ car or any car for that matter is beyond a joke. I strongly advise you don‚Äôt buy a car from cinch. The service once the car has been bought is terrible

Cowboy scammers : My car was sold, the company who purchased it contacted me to arrange the pick up, the date was 1 week later, disappointed but ok.  They turned up mob handed, 3 blokes, one looked like a 6'5" fighter. They looked at and commented on how great it was for its age.  They wanted their mechanic to take it for a test drive, all 3 blokes and me took the car out, once we finished the test drive the one guy asked the mechanic was it ok to which the mechanic said "yes great" then I overheard them muttering to eachother and the mechanic said to the fool with a clip board "you could say fly wheel" then the clip board guy said to me "it's got lots of problems, flywheel, sunroof, tyres..." All absolutely untrue, then offered me ¬£1500 less than the sale price. Obviously because I overheard them conspiracy to scam me I told them where to go. I contacted Motorway to report it and they said they will look into it. I then gets an email from Motorway saying the buyer pulled out due to a broken gear box! If I wanted to relist the car I would need to get a full mechanical report for the car..... Obviously I was subject to a scamming garage and hopefully this isn't what happens to everyone.  I used I different company to sell the car in the end, they where delighted with it, low miles, fantastic condition.  Just be careful guys, don't be taken for a mug.

Please Read, Honest Review! : Honestly please don‚Äôt buy a car from cinch, I would never recommend anyone to do so. I purchased a car from them and it was nothing as they advertised, front suspension damage, tyres were unaligned, disc pads were corroded, lots more imperfections than they stated. One thing I did notice after doing some extensive research the cars are mostly auctioned cars, so when the cars are not checked before delivery and just wizzed through and valeted causes all sorts of issues. The person that delivered my car was even embarrassed to delivery the vehicle. Took me 6 months to get all my money back, the car spent more time in the garage than i drove it. Had to get the finance company involved and the ombudsman, please don‚Äôt waste your time, you are buying the 2nd most expensive thing your will ever purchase and your not viewing it, do not be fooled into there marketing. The customer service are none existent and take you on a wild goose chase. Sorry hope this review as helped because it caused me a lot of stress and inconvenience.

Terrible to deal with : ITerrible to deal with. I got my car delivered on 12th January. I have so far reported 4 faults and nothing has been dealt with. I have spent hours on live chat, which there is never anyone available to chat too and phoning uninterested advisors. Today I eventually got an email to take my car to a garage which is 100 miles away at 9 am on a Monday morning. 2 of the faults are relating to engine management warnings and start/stop warning, so not exactly minor issues. The warning ‚ÄòEngine Service‚Äô appears when I start my car. The 100 mile appointment was just to run a diagnostic test and not fix. The email advised that I would be required to make my own arrangements home. I stay in Greenock which is a large town with many garages. I am also 20 miles from Glasgow, biggest city in Scotland, 3rd largest in the UK, yet they give me an appointment 100 miles away in a crappy wee town. I would advise anyone to consider carefully before using Cazoo.

no hassle  : First time selling a car "privately" (i.e. as opposed to part exchange), and I used Motorway after reading the good reviews. The process was very easy to follow (taking the photos / uploading documents etc.). I was happy with the estimate but the final bid came in at slightly less.  But, was still much higher than other car buying companies and some dealers (>1.5 K higher). Dealer was a bit slow in arranging collection, but this wasn't Motorways fault. Fully expected dealer might try to chip into the price (I've heard of others doing so) but, no, got full bid price and it took less than 10 minutes for payment to land in account. Collection driver waited for payment to hit my account before taking car.  Despite my initial reservations, I have no hesitation in recommending the service, just make sure that you are open and honest about car condition.  Much less hassle than actual private sale.

APPALLING AFTER SALES EXPERIENCE !!!!! : My daughter bought a car in June 2023 including a 3 months warranty. Within that time the infotainment screen developed a fault. Contacting the company produced a response of "you signed a disclaimer that this was not covered" !!1 Absolutely rubbish no such disclaimer was signed. Numerous phone  calls followed with long wait times (upto 45 minutes) told someone would get back to her - never happened! Eventually contacted the finance company who "investigated" and said she should contact the Ombudsman service. Amazingly, shortly afterwards Cazoo contacted my daughter to say they would carry out the repair under the warranty. Since then they have given her a date for the repair but cannot organise a replacement vehicle. They were told that she was a nursing student attending university 9 - 5 every day of the week. Cazoo keep saying they are trying to organise this. When she phones Cazoo(Manchester) there are long wait times if it is answered at all. It seems that Moneyclaim Online is the only way forward.

Pleasantly surprised! : I have always used Autotrader to sell my cars but had my fair share of time wasters. A friend suggested Motorway as an alternative. The way it works is you supply many photos of the car and documents, and more photos to prove your identity. Motorway then send all this to a network of dealers (not private individuals) and wait for a response. I only had to wait two days before a dealer in the midlands showed an interest in my car. A few days later someone came to view the car, made an offer which I accepted and drove the car away. I received payment almost immediately. I would definitely use Motorway again.
